css\/properties\/widows.SUMMARY:
Defines the minimum number of lines that can appear in the beginning of a new page. In typography, a widow is the last line of a paragraph appearing alone at the top of a page, which is considered to look awkward. Setting the widows property to an integer higher than 1 prevents this.

On a non-paged media, like screen, the widows CSS property has no effect. It can have a number value or it can inherit the values from the parent element.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Takes the same specified value as the property for the element's parent.
VALUES.TITLE: inherit

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Denotes the minimum amount of lines that can stay alone on the top of a new page. If the value is not positive, the declaration is invalid.
VALUES.TITLE: integer

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: An integer, followed by a %. The value is the ratio of kashida expansion to white space expansion. 100% specifies kashida expansion only, and 0% specifies white space expansion only
VALUES.TITLE: percentage

css\/properties\/outline-color.SUMMARY: The outline-color property sets the color of the outline of an element. An outline is a line that is drawn around elements, outside the border edge, to make the element stand out.
css\/properties\/outline-color.COMPUTEDVALUE: The computed value for ‘invert’ is ‘invert’. For <color> values, the computed value is as defined for the ‘color’ property.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: This is expected to perform a color inversion on the pixels on the screen.
VALUES.TITLE: invert

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: This is a keyword indicating that the value is inherited from their parent's element calculated value.
VALUES.TITLE: inherit

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Specify the color to use on all outlines. This can be anywhere from one to four values representing the top, right, bottom, and left outline respectively.
VALUES.TITLE: <color>

css\/properties\/left.SUMMARY: Sets the left edge of an element

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Integer, followed by a percent sign (%). The value is a percentage of the width of the parent object.
VALUES.TITLE: percentage

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Floating-point number, followed by an absolute units designator (cm, mm, in, pt, or pc) or a relative units designator (em, ex, or px). For more information about the supported length units, see CSS Values and Units Reference.
VALUES.TITLE: length

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. Default position, according to the regular HTML layout of the page.
VALUES.TITLE: auto

css\/properties\/mask-position.SUMMARY: The "mask-position" property sets the initial position of a mask image. Position can be specified in terms of percentages of the distance from upper left corner (original point) or using the keywords top, left, center, right, or bottom.
css\/properties\/mask-position.COMPUTEDVALUE: A list, each item consisting of: two keywords representing the origin and two offsets from that origin, each given as an absolute length (if given a <length>), otherwise as a percentage.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: the first number represents the percentage of distance away from the left side of the page, the second number represents the percentage of distance away from the upper side of the page. With a initial value pair of 0% 0%, the mask image is be placed at the upper left corner of the page. . With a value pair of 30% 70%, the mask image is be placed at the point 30% across and 70% down the page.
VALUES.TITLE: <percentage>

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: equivalent to 100% for second ( vertical ) number
VALUES.TITLE: bottom

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: the first number represents the distance away from the left side of the page, the second number represents the distance away from the upper side of the page.
VALUES.TITLE: <length>

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: equivalent to 50% 50%
VALUES.TITLE: center

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: equivalent to 100% for first ( horizontal ) number
VALUES.TITLE: right

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: equivalent to 0% for second ( vertical ) number
VALUES.TITLE: top

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: equivalent to 0% for first ( horizontal ) number
VALUES.TITLE: left

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The maximum value for the scrollTop property.
VALUES.TITLE: length

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The maximum value for the scrollTop property is equal to scrollHeight.
VALUES.TITLE: auto

css\/properties\/flex-flow.SUMMARY: The flex-flow CSS property defines the flex container's main and cross axis. It is a shorthand property for the flex-direction and flex-wrap properties.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION:
The shorthand value includes the values of the following properties:

  • flex-direction
  • flex-wrap
VALUES.TITLE: <flex-direction> <flex-wrap>

css\/properties\/writing-mode.SUMMARY: writing-mode specifies if lines of text are laid out horizontally or vertically, and the direction which lines of text and blocks progress.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Lines of text are laid out vertically, and progress from the right to the left of the page. Asian languages, such as Chinese or Japanese traditionally used this writing mode.
VALUES.TITLE: vertical-rl

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Lines of text are laid out vertically, and progress from the left to the right of the page. Mongolian-based writing systems typically use this writing mode.
VALUES.TITLE: vertical-lr

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Lines of text are laid out horizontally, and progress from the top to the bottom of the page. This is the writing mode used in many writing systems, such as Latin, Greek, Cyrillic, Arabic, Hebrew, etc.
VALUES.TITLE: horizontal-tb

css\/properties\/overflow-style.SUMMARY: Specifies the preferred scrolling methods for elements that overflow.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A panner is typically a rectangle shown in one corner of the element, with a smaller rectangle inside. The larger rectangle represents all the available content of the element and the smaller one the visible part. The smaller rectangle can be moved around by the user to move the content of the element accordingly.
VALUES.TITLE: panner

VALUES.DESCRIPTION:
Indicates the element does not display any scrolling mechanism, even when its content overflows.

Unlike overflow: hidden, elements with overflow-style: none can still be scrolled via touch panning, keyboard, or mouse wheel.
VALUES.TITLE: none

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Initial value. Indicates no preference.
VALUES.TITLE: auto

VALUES.DESCRIPTION:
Indicates the element displays a classic scrollbar-type control when its content overflows.

Scrollbars do not overlay content, and therefore take up extra layout space along the edges of the element where they appear.
VALUES.TITLE: scrollbar

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The value ‘move’ refers to a method where the user can move the content of the element directly (rather than indirectly by moving a scrollbar or a panner). Typically, the mouse pointer changes into a hand or a cross of four arrows to indicate that the user can drag the content around with the mouse. Sometimes the user needs to explicitly activate the move mode and in that case he often can use both dragging (with the mouse) and key events to move the content.
VALUES.TITLE: move

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The marquee effect (value ‘marquee’) consists of the content moving autonomously, without any user events to control it. A user who waits long enough will eventually see all the content that overflows.
VALUES.TITLE: marquee

css\/properties\/text-indent.SUMMARY: Specifies the amount of space horizontally that should be left on the first line of the text of an element. This horizontal spacing is at the beginning of the first line and is in respect to the left edge of the containing block box.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION:
This value can only be used in conjunction with a length or percentage value (text-indent: 7px each-line;). It indents all lines in the element, not just the first line.

Currently an experimental feature.
VALUES.TITLE: <length/percentage> each-line

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Floating-point number, followed by an absolute units designator (cm, mm, in, pt, or pc) or a relative units designator (em, ex, or px).
VALUES.TITLE: length

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Integer, followed by a percent sign (%). This value is a percentage of the width of the parent object.
VALUES.TITLE: percentage

VALUES.DESCRIPTION:
This value can only be used in conjunction with a length or percentage value (text-indent: 7px each-line;). It will affect not only the first line of the block container but also any line that is after a forced line break. This does not have affect on soft wrap break.

Currently experimental in CSS Text Level 3
VALUES.TITLE: <length/percentage> each-line

VALUES.DESCRIPTION:
This value can only be used in conjunction with a length or percentage value (text-indent: 7px hanging;). It inverts which lines are indented so that everything but the first formatted line is indented.

Currently an experimental feature.
VALUES.TITLE: <length/percentage> hanging

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Inherits the value from the cascade.
VALUES.TITLE: inherit

css\/properties\/marquee-style.SUMMARY: The 'marquee-style' property determines a marquee's scrolling behavior.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Bounce back and forth.
VALUES.TITLE: alternate

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Start completely off one side, scroll all the way across and completely off.
VALUES.TITLE: scroll

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Start completely off one side, scroll in, and stop as soon as no more content is off that side.
VALUES.TITLE: slide

css\/properties\/mask-box-image.SUMMARY: This is a shorthand property for setting ‘mask-box-image-source’, ‘mask-box-image-slice’, ‘mask-box-image-width’, ‘mask-box-image-outset’ and ‘mask-box-image-repeat’. Omitted values are set to their initial values.

css\/properties\/mask.SUMMARY: Masking is a combination of opacity values and clipping. Like clipping you can use shapes, text or paths to define sections of the mask. The default state of a mask is fully transparent which is the opposite of clipping plane. The graphics in a mask sets how opaque portions of the mask are.

css\/properties\/grid-auto-flow.SUMMARY: The ‘grid-auto-flow’ property controls the direction to place content in unoccupied spaces: either by rows, or by columns, or without specification of rows or columns, in other words based on the next available space in order.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Causes items to be placed by filling each row in turn, adding new rows as necessary.
VALUES.TITLE: rows

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Causes items to be placed at the next available space that provides sufficient span. The slot selected will have its before and start edges at the first grid line in the relevant dimension, and its after and end edges to the amount of span specified on the grid item. (If no span is specified, the default span is 1.)
VALUES.TITLE: none

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Causes items to be placed by filling each column in turn, adding new columns as necessary.
VALUES.TITLE: columns

css\/properties\/overflow-wrap.SUMMARY: This property specifies whether or not particularly long words will be 'broken' (separated into multiple lines) if necessary in order to fit in within its container.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION:
Lines can only be broken at normal break points (spaces, non-alphanumeric characters, etc.)

This is the default option.
VALUES.TITLE: normal

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Lines can be broken at any point if necessary to preverse the limits of the container element -- for example, "hamburger" can be broken into "ham" and "burger" across separate lines.
VALUES.TITLE: break-word

css\/properties\/border-left-color.SUMMARY:
The CSS border-left-color property sets the color of an element's left border. This page explains the border-left-color value, but often you will find it more convenient to fix the border's left color as part of a shorthand set, either border-left or border-color.

Colors can be defined several ways. For more information, see Usage.
css\/properties\/border-left-color.INITIALVALUE: color - The value of the 'color' property
css\/properties\/border-left-color.COMPUTEDVALUE: when taken from the 'color' property, the computed value of 'color'; otherwise, as specified

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The computed value of the ‘color’ property. This value can be a basic color keyword, such as red or lavenderblush, a numerical value, an RGB or RGBA value, or an HSL or HSLA value. For more information, see Usage.
VALUES.TITLE: <color>

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The same as ‘color: inherit’, the color value inherited from parent object.
VALUES.TITLE: currentColor

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: currentColor, the color value inherited from parent object.
VALUES.TITLE: inherit

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Fully transparent. This keyword can be considered a shorthand for transparent black, rgba(0,0,0,0), which is its computed value.
VALUES.TITLE: transparent

css\/properties\/border-width.SUMMARY: Sets the width of an element's four borders. This property can have from one to four values. This is a shorthand property for setting values simultaneously for border-top-width, border-right-width, border-bottom-width, and border-left-width.
css\/properties\/border-width.COMPUTEDVALUE: An absolute length, for all 4 values; 0 if the border style is 'none' or 'hidden'

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Greater than the default width.
VALUES.TITLE: thick

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Less than the default width.
VALUES.TITLE: thin

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Shorthand syntax. See notes below.
VALUES.TITLE: <border-top-width> <border-right-width> <border-bottom-width> <border-left-width>

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Floating-point number, followed by an absolute units designator (cm, mm, in, pt, or pc) or a relative units designator (em, ex, or px). For more information about the supported length units, see CSS Values and Units Reference.
VALUES.TITLE: <width>

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default.
VALUES.TITLE: medium

css\/properties\/font-size-adjust.SUMMARY: The font-size-adjust property adjusts the font-size of the fallback fonts defined with font-family, so that the x-height is the same no matter what font is used. This preserves the readability of the text when fallback happens.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Only use the font-size value to determine the size of the font.
VALUES.TITLE: none

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The aspect value is calculated by the browser for the first font in the font-family list, and used for every font in that list.
VALUES.TITLE: auto

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The value used in calculating the size of the fallback fonts. For the adjusted font size calculation, see Notes.
VALUES.TITLE: number

css\/properties\/grid-auto-rows.SUMMARY: The size of rows when row size has not been explicitly sized by ‘grid-definition-row’.
css\/properties\/grid-auto-rows.COMPUTEDVALUE: Relative to the height of the grid container. If the extent of the grid container is an indefinite size, <percentage> values relative to that size are treated as ‘auto’.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The size range of the track. Greater than or equal to min and less than or equal to max. If max less than min, then max is ignored and ‘minmax(min,max)’ is treated as min.
VALUES.TITLE: <track-minmax>

css\/properties\/column-gap.SUMMARY: The column-gap property controls the width of the gap between columns in multi-column elements.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION:
A floating-point number, followed by either an absolute units designator (cm, mm, in, pt, or pc) or a relative units designator (em, ex, or px), that indicates the width of the gap between columns. For more information about the supported length units, see CSS Length Units Reference.


Negative values are not valid.
VALUES.TITLE: length

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. The width of the normal value is user-agent specific, but 1em is suggested.
VALUES.TITLE: normal

css\/properties\/margin-top.SUMMARY: margin-top sets the top margin of an element.
css\/properties\/margin-top.INITIALVALUE: Depends on the particular element. Different elements have different default margins.
css\/properties\/margin-top.COMPUTEDVALUE: As specified, but with relative lengths converted into absolute pixel values.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Specifies a fixed length, using any standard CSS length units . Negative Values are allowed.
VALUES.TITLE: length

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A percentage of the width of the containing block. Negative values are allowed. (Even though this is margin-top, the browser will take the percentage from the width, not the height of the containing block.)
VALUES.TITLE: percentage

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Inherits the parent element's specified margin-top width.
VALUES.TITLE: inherit

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The browser calculates a bottom margin dependent on the space available.
VALUES.TITLE: auto

css\/properties\/width.SUMMARY: Specifies the width of the content area of an element. The content area of the element width does not include the padding, border, and margin of the element.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The containing block width minus horizontal margin, border, and padding
VALUES.TITLE: available

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: If border-box is used, the length or percentage defined will be applied to the element's border box.
VALUES.TITLE: border-box

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The intrinsic minimum width
VALUES.TITLE: min-content

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The intrinsic preferred width
VALUES.TITLE: max-content

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: This will be either the large of the minimum width or the smaller of the preferred width and the available width
VALUES.TITLE: fit-content

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: If content-box is used, the length or percentage defined will be applied to the element's content-box.
VALUES.TITLE: content-box

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Will take a number that is immediately followed by a length unit such as px, em, in, etc.
VALUES.TITLE: length

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: If auto is set for the elements width, the browser will determine the width for the element.
VALUES.TITLE: auto

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Integer, followed by a %. The value is a percentage of the width of the parent object, whether or not it is specified explicitly. Negative values are not allowed.
VALUES.TITLE: percentage

css\/properties\/float.SUMMARY: Elements which have the style float are floated horizontally. These elements can move as far to the left or right of the containing element. All elements after the floating element will flow around it, but elements before the floating element are not impacted. If several floating elements are placed after each other, they will float next to each other as long as there is room.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The left value indicates that the element must float to the far left side of its containing block.
VALUES.TITLE: left

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The right value indicates that the element must float to the far right side of its containing block.
VALUES.TITLE: right

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: none indicates that the element does not contain any float at all. This is the initial value of the float property.
VALUES.TITLE: none

css\/properties\/caption-side.SUMMARY: Specifies the placement of a table caption.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Positions the caption box above the table box.
VALUES.TITLE: top

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Positions the caption box below the table box.
VALUES.TITLE: bottom

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Takes the same specified value as the property for the element's parent.
VALUES.TITLE: inherit

css\/properties\/font-stretch.SUMMARY: Allows you to expand or condense the widths for a normal, condensed, or expanded font face.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: This is the least expanded setting.
VALUES.TITLE: semi-expanded

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: This is the second most condensed setting.
VALUES.TITLE: extra-condensed

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: This is the most condensed setting.
VALUES.TITLE: ultra-condensed

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: This is the default setting.
VALUES.TITLE: normal

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: This expands the font face in Internet Explorer only.
VALUES.TITLE: wider (Internet Explorer only)

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: This is the second most expanded setting.
VALUES.TITLE: extra-expanded

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Some font faces incorporate a condensed option, this is the equivalent of that setting.
VALUES.TITLE: condensed

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: This condenses the font face in Internet Explorer only.
VALUES.TITLE: narrower (Internet Explorer only)

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: This is the least condensed setting.
VALUES.TITLE: semi-condensed

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Some font faces incorporate an expanded option, this is the equivalent of that setting.
VALUES.TITLE: expanded

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: This is the most expanded setting.
VALUES.TITLE: ultra-expanded

css\/properties\/backface-visibility.SUMMARY: Determines whether or not the “back” side of a transformed element is visible when facing the viewer.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The back face of an element is a transparent background, displaying a mirror image of the front face when the back face is observable.
VALUES.TITLE: visible

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: There are cases when we do not want the front face of an element to be visible through the back face, like when doing a flipping card effect (setting two elements side-to-side). In this case, the property should be set to hidden to make the back face of the element opaque.
VALUES.TITLE: hidden

css\/properties\/hyphenate-limit-lines.SUMMARY: Indicates the maximum number of successive hyphenated lines in an element. The ‘no-limit’ value means that there is no limit.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION:
Indicates the maximum number of successive hyphenated lines.

For instance, if 2, then no more than 2 successive lines may end with a hyphenated word. If 0 then no lines may end with a hyphenated word. (Hyphenation is effectively disabled.)

Negative values are not allowed.
VALUES.TITLE: [[css/data_types/integer|integer]]

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Indicates that hyphenation is not limited based on the number of consecutive hyphenated lines. In the flow above the consecutive hyphenated lines limit would be an infinitely large positive number.
VALUES.TITLE: no-limit

css\/properties\/font-feature-settings.SUMMARY: The font-feature-settings property gets or sets one or more values that specify glyph substitution and positioning in fonts that include OpenType layout features.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. No change in glyph substitution or positioning occurs.
VALUES.TITLE: normal

VALUES.DESCRIPTION:
This property can take up to two separate parts in its value. The options are as follows:

  • OpenType feature tag: Comma-separated list of one or more OpenType layout feature tags (each with an optional toggle). See Notes for examples of correct syntax, plus a table of the most common feature tags and their definitions.
  • Indicator: 0 indicates that the feature is disabled. For boolean features, 1 indicates that feature is enabled. A value of ‘on’ is synonymous with 1 and ‘off’ is synonymous with 0. For non-boolean features, 1 or greater indicates the feature selection index.
VALUES.TITLE: "OpenType feature tag" Indicator

css\/properties\/page-break-before.SUMMARY: The page-break-before property sets the page-breaking behavior before an element.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Insert page breaks before the element until it reaches a blank right page.
VALUES.TITLE: right

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Insert a page break before the element.
VALUES.TITLE: always

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Specifies that the value of the page-break-before property should be inherited from the parent element
VALUES.TITLE: inherit

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Insert page breaks before the element until it reaches a blank left page.
VALUES.TITLE: left

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Avoid inserting a page break before the element.
VALUES.TITLE: avoid

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Behaves the same as auto.
VALUES.TITLE: empty string

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. Insert a page break before the element if necessary.
VALUES.TITLE: auto

css\/properties\/animation-delay.SUMMARY: Defines the length of time that must elapse before an animation starts

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: This value defines the initial delay for two animations. Like durations, delays can be specified in seconds or milliseconds.
VALUES.TITLE: .25s, 100ms

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The initial value of 0s means the animation will start executing as soon as it is applied through the [css/properties/animation-name
VALUES.TITLE: 0s

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: If the value for animation-delay is negative then the animation will execute the moment it is applied but will begin execution at the specified offset. That is, the animation appears to begin part-way through its play cycle.
VALUES.TITLE: -1.5s

css\/properties\/padding-bottom.SUMMARY: The padding-bottom is an optional CSS property of an element that sets the padding space required below an element. The padding area is the space between an element and its border. Negative values are not allowed but decimal values are permitted. The element size is treated as fixed, and the content of the element shifts toward the center as padding is increased. Negative values are not permitted.
css\/properties\/padding-bottom.COMPUTEDVALUE: the percentage as specified or a absolute length

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Specifies a positive fixed distance. See length for details. Can not be a negative number.
VALUES.TITLE: length

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Calculated using the dimensions of the containing block or element.
VALUES.TITLE: percentage

css\/properties\/animation-timing-functi.SUMMARY: Defines how the intermediate property values used during an animation are calculated

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. The animation begins and ends gradually; this value is equivalent to cubic-bezier(0.25,0.1,0.25,1).
VALUES.TITLE: ease

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Equivalent to steps(1,start).
VALUES.TITLE: step-start

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Specifies a stepping function using two parameters. The first parameter specifies the number of intervals in the function. It must be a positive integer greater than 0. The second optional is either the value start or end and specifies the point at which the change of values occur within the interval. If the second parameter is omitted, it is given the value end.
VALUES.TITLE: steps(3, end)

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Specifies a cubic bezier curve. The four values specify points P1 and P2 of the curve as (x1, y1, x2, y2). Both x values must be in the range [0, 1] or the definition is invalid. The y values can exceed this range. This function is used to specify custom timing functions.
VALUES.TITLE: cubic-bezier(0,0,1,1)

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The animation begins at a steady rate then gradually ends; this value is equivalent to cubic-bezier(0,0,0.58,1).
VALUES.TITLE: ease-out

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Equivalent to steps(1,end).
VALUES.TITLE: step-end

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The animation begins and ends gradually; equivalent to cubic-bezier(0.42,0,0.58,1). Note that this timing function is similar to ease thought the latter starts faster than it ends.
VALUES.TITLE: ease-in-out

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The animation begins and progresses at a constant rate over the specified duration; this value is equivalent to cubic-bezier(0,0,1,1)
VALUES.TITLE: linear

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The animation begins gradually and progresses at a steady rate; this value is equivalent to cubic-bezier(0.42,0,1,1).
VALUES.TITLE: ease-in

css\/properties\/text-decoration-line.SUMMARY: The text-decoration-line CSS property sets what kind of line decorations are added to an element.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Each line of text has a line above it.
VALUES.TITLE: overline

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Each line of text is underlined.
VALUES.TITLE: underline

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Each line of text has a line through the middle.
VALUES.TITLE: line-through

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Produces no text decoration.
VALUES.TITLE: none

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Mozilla CSS Extension, not suitable for web content.
VALUES.TITLE: -moz-anchor-decoration

css\/properties\/border-bottom-color.SUMMARY:
Sets the color of the bottom border. This page explains the border-bottom-color value, but often you will find it more convenient to fix the border's bottom color as part of a shorthand set, either border-bottom or border-color.

Colors can be defined several ways. For more information, see Usage.
css\/properties\/border-bottom-color.INITIALVALUE: color - The value of the 'color' property
css\/properties\/border-bottom-color.COMPUTEDVALUE: when taken from the 'color' property, the computed value of 'color'; otherwise, as specified

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Fully transparent. This keyword can be considered a shorthand for transparent black, rgba(0,0,0,0), which is its computed value.
VALUES.TITLE: transparent

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: currentColor, the color value inherited from parent object.
VALUES.TITLE: inherit

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The same as ‘color: inherit’, the color value inherited from parent object.
VALUES.TITLE: currentColor

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The computed value of the ‘color’ property. This value can be a basic color keyword, such as red or lavenderblush, a numerical value, an RGB or RGBA value, or an HSL or HSLA value. For more information, see Usage.
VALUES.TITLE: <color>

css\/properties\/color.SUMMARY: The color property sets the color of an element's foreground content (usually text), accepting any standard CSS color from keywords and hex values to RGB(a) and HSL(a).
css\/properties\/color.INITIALVALUE: black, except in a few cases (see notes)
css\/properties\/color.COMPUTEDVALUE: For a non-translucent color, an hexadecimal equivalent is used. Otherwise it is the RGBa equivalent

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: CSS color value
VALUES.TITLE: color

css\/properties\/box-decoration-break.SUMMARY: Breaks a box into fragments creating new borders, padding and repeating backgrounds or lets it stay as a continuous box on a page break, column break, or, for inline elements, at a line break.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Each box fragment is independently wrapped with the border and padding. The border-radius and border-image and box-shadow, if any, are applied to each fragment independently. The background is drawn independently in each fragment of the element. A no-repeat background image will thus be rendered once in each fragment of the element.
VALUES.TITLE: clone

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: No border and no padding are inserted at a break. No box-shadow is drawn at a broken edge; border-radius does not apply to its corners; and the border-image is rendered for the whole box as if it were unbroken. The effect is as though the element were rendered with no breaks present, and then sliced by the breaks afterward. Backgrounds are drawn as if, after the element has been laid out (including any justification, reordering, page breaks, etc.), all the element's box fragments were taken and put one after the other in visual order. The background is applied to the bounding box of this composite box and then the fragments are put back, with each with its share of the background.
VALUES.TITLE: slice

css\/properties\/font-family.SUMMARY: The font-family property allows one or more font family names and/or generic family names to be specified for usage on the selected element(s)' text. The browser then goes through the list; for each character in the selection it applies the first font family that has an available glyph for that character.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: You can specify a comma-separated list of multiple font family names and/or generic family names, although it rarely makes sense to specify more than one generic family. This list is called a font-stack. The browser goes down the list and uses the first available font that it can find available on the system. Generic font families are used as a fallback when none of the fonts specified in the stack are available. It is always the last alternative in the list of font family names.
VALUES.TITLE: family-name, family-name, generic-family

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The name of a font family, such as courier or arial. You can reference fonts available on the user's system, or external fonts imported using @font-face. When the family name contains more than one word, it should be enclosed in quotes, for example 'Comic Sans'.
VALUES.TITLE: family-name

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: generic families are not specific fonts, but a reference to fallback fonts of a general type that can be used when specific fonts are not available. The actual fonts used for each fallback type may differ between operating systems. The following generic family keywords are defined: serif, sans-serif, cursive, fantasy and monospace.
VALUES.TITLE: generic-family

css\/properties\/padding-right.SUMMARY: The padding-right CSS property of an element sets the padding space required on the right side of an element.
css\/properties\/padding-right.COMPUTEDVALUE: the percentage as specified or the absolute length

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A percentage with respect to the width of the containing block.
VALUES.TITLE: percentage

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Specifies a positive fixed width. See length for details.
VALUES.TITLE: length

css\/properties\/box-pack.SUMMARY: Do not use. This property has been replaced by flex-pack.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The ending edge of the first child element is placed at the end of the parent element; the ending edge of the next child element is placed edge to edge with the starting edge of the first child element; and so on along the layout axis direction. All space remaining along the layout axis is placed at the start of the layout axis.
VALUES.TITLE: end

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The starting edge of the first child element is placed at the start of the parent element; the ending edge of the last child element is placed edge to edge with the end of the parent box; and all remaining children are placed between the first and last child elements, so that any space that remains along the layout axis is equally distributed between child elements.
VALUES.TITLE: justify

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The starting edge of the first child element is placed at the start of the parent element; the starting edge of the next child element is placed edge to edge with the ending edge of the first child element; and so on along the layout axis direction. All space that remains along the layout axis is placed at the end of the layout axis.
VALUES.TITLE: start

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: All child elements are placed edge to edge with each other, as described in the descriptions for the [#start start] or [#end end] keywords. However, the group of child elements is centered between the starting and ending edges of the parent element so that all remaining space is evenly distributed before the first child element and after the last child element.
VALUES.TITLE: center

css\/properties\/mask-box-image-outset.SUMMARY:
The values specify the amount of the image area of the mask box that extends beyond the border box. If there are four values, they set the outsets on the top, right, bottom and left sides in that order. If the left is missing, it is the same as the right; if the bottom is missing, it is the same as the top; if the right is missing, it is the same as the top.

As with ‘mask-box-image-width’, a <number> represents a multiple of the corresponding ‘border-width’. Negative values are not allowed for any of the ‘mask-box-image-outset’ values.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Initial value. Panning and scrolling are unaffected by any defined snap-points. Touch flicks will result in normal inertia.
VALUES.TITLE: none

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Inertia is adjusted to ensure content always lands on a snap point.
VALUES.TITLE: mandatory

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: When normal inertia would leave content near a snap point, inertia is adjusted to land exactly on the snap point. However, it is still possible to land between snap points.
VALUES.TITLE: proximity

css\/properties\/text-overline.SUMMARY: The text-overline property is the shorthand for the text-overline-style, text-overline-width, text-overline-color, and text-overline-mode properties.

css\/properties\/text-align-last.SUMMARY: The text-align-last CSS property describes how the last line of a block element or a line before line break is aligned in its parent block element.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Text is justified if ‘text-justify’ is ‘distribute’, and the same as start value if otherwise.
VALUES.TITLE: justify

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The same as right if direction is left-to-right and left if direction is right-to-left.
VALUES.TITLE: end

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Text is aligned to the right.
VALUES.TITLE: right

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The same as left if direction is left-to-right and right if direction is right-to-left.
VALUES.TITLE: start

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The text is centered within the line box.
VALUES.TITLE: center

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Text is aligned to the left.
VALUES.TITLE: left

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. Text is aligned like the other lines in the object, using the value of the text-align property.
VALUES.TITLE: auto

css\/properties\/text-overline-mode.SUMMARY: Sets the mode for the overline text decoration, determining whether the text decoration affects the space characters or not.

css\/properties\/text-underline-style.SUMMARY:
After review this should be replaced by text-decoration should it not?

This property will set the underline style for text with a line value for underline, overline, and line-through.
css\/properties\/text-underline-style.COMPUTEDVALUE: specified value - except for initial and inherit

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: This will produce no line.
VALUES.TITLE: none

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: This will produce a wavy line.
VALUES.TITLE: wave

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: This will produce a line that has a repeating pattern of a dot followed by a dash.
VALUES.TITLE: dot-dash

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: This will produce a dashed line
VALUES.TITLE: dashed

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: This will produce a line that has a repeating pattern of two dots followed by a dash.
VALUES.TITLE: dot-dot-dash

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: This will produce a dotted line.
VALUES.TITLE: dotted

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: This will produce a double line.
VALUES.TITLE: double

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: This will produce a solid line.
VALUES.TITLE: solid

css\/properties\/text-overline-width.SUMMARY: Specifies the line width for the overline text decoration.

css\/properties\/mask-source-type.SUMMARY: The ‘mask-source-type’ property indicates whether the <mask-reference> is treated as a luminescence mask or a alpha mask.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: "source type" has following values: "alpha"
VALUES.TITLE: <source-type>

css\/properties\/flex-grow.SUMMARY: The flex-grow CSS property specifies how much a flex item will enlarge with respect to the other items in the flex container to fill an expanded container.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The flex grow factor, which describes the proportion by which the flex item will grow relative to the other flex items in the container. Negative numbers are invalid.
VALUES.TITLE: number

VALUES.DESCRIPTION:
Specifies the position of individual snap-points.

  • If the value specified in <start lengths> is less than -ms-scroll-limit-x-min the value of -ms-scroll-limit-x-min is used.
  • If the value specified in <list lengths> is greater that -ms-scroll-limit-x-max, the value of -ms-scroll-limit-x-max is used.
VALUES.TITLE: snapList(<list lengths>)

VALUES.DESCRIPTION:
Specifies where the snap-points will be placed.

  • <start length> specifies where the first snap-point will be placed.
  • <step length> specifies the distance between subsequent snap-points both to the left and the right of the initial snap-point.
VALUES.TITLE: snapInterval(<start length>, <step length>)

VALUES.DESCRIPTION:
Specifies where the snap-points will be placed.

  • <start length> specifies where the first snap-point will be placed.
  • <step length> specifies the distance between subsequent snap-points both to the left and the right of the initial snap-point.
VALUES.TITLE: snapInterval(<start length>, <step length>)

VALUES.DESCRIPTION:
Specifies the position of individual snap-points.

  • If the value specified in <list lengths> is less than -ms-scroll-limit-x-min the value of -ms-scroll-limit-x-min is used.
  • If the value specified in <list lengths> is greater that -ms-scroll-limit-x-max, the value of -ms-scroll-limit-x-max is used.
VALUES.TITLE: snapList(<list lengths>)

css\/properties\/text-line-through-mode.SUMMARY: Sets the mode for the line-through text decoration, determining whether the text decoration affects the space characters or not.

css\/properties\/height.SUMMARY: Sets the height of an element. The content area of the element height does not include the padding, border, and margin of the element.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: If content-box is used, the height or percentage defined will be applied to the element's content-box.
VALUES.TITLE: content-box

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The intrinsic minimum height
VALUES.TITLE: min-content

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: This will be either the large of the minimum height or the smaller of the preferred height and the available height
VALUES.TITLE: fit-content

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Will take a number that is immediately followed by a length unit such as px, em, in, etc.
VALUES.TITLE: height

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: If auto is set for the elements height, the browser will determine the height for the element.
VALUES.TITLE: auto

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The intrinsic preferred height
VALUES.TITLE: max-content

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: If border-box is used, the height or percentage defined will be applied to the element's border box.
VALUES.TITLE: border-box

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The containing block height minus horizontal margin, border, and padding
VALUES.TITLE: available

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Integer followed by a percent sign (%). The value is a percentage of the height of the parent object, which must be specified explicitly. Negative values are not allowed.
VALUES.TITLE: percentage

css\/properties\/border-bottom-left-radi.SUMMARY: Defines the shape of the border of the bottom-left corner.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Denotes the size of the circle radius, or the semi-major and semi-minor axes of the ellipsis, using percentage values. Percentages for the horizontal axis refer to the width of the box, percentages for the vertical axis refer to the height of the box. Negative values are invalid.
VALUES.TITLE: percentage

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Denotes the size of the circle radius or the semi-major and semi-minor axes of the ellipsis. It can be expressed in any unit allowed by the CSS <length> data types. Negative values are invalid.
VALUES.TITLE: length

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Child elements are displayed in a vertical stack from top to bottom.
VALUES.TITLE: vertical

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. Child elements are displayed along the inline axis.
VALUES.TITLE: inline-axis

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Child elements are displayed in a horizontal line from left to right.
VALUES.TITLE: horizontal

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Child elements are displayed along the block axis.
VALUES.TITLE: block-axis

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Child elements are displayed in the same orientation as the computed value of this property for the parent element.
VALUES.TITLE: inherit

css\/properties\/order.SUMMARY: The order property controls the order in which flex items appear within their flex container, by assigning them to ordinal groups.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The ordinal group for this flex item.
VALUES.TITLE: <integer>

css\/properties\/text-line-through-style.SUMMARY: Specifies the line style for line-through text decoration.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The object is centered within the row.
VALUES.TITLE: center

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. The object is placed at the top of the row.
VALUES.TITLE: start

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The object is placed at the bottom of the row.
VALUES.TITLE: end

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The object is stretched to completely fill the height that is available in the row.
VALUES.TITLE: stretch

css\/properties\/white-space.SUMMARY: The white-space property controls if a white-space character within an element can wrap or if it must be preserved.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Sequences of line breaks are preserved.
VALUES.TITLE: pre-line

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Lines of text break automatically. Content wraps to the next line if it exceeds the width of the object.
VALUES.TITLE: normal

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Line breaks are suppressed. Content does not wrap to the next line.
VALUES.TITLE: nowrap

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Line breaks and other whitespace are preserved. This possible value is supported starting in Internet Explorer 6 when the !DOCTYPE declaration specifies standards-compliant mode. When the !DOCTYPE declaration does not specify standards-compliant mode, you can retrieve this value, but it does not affect rendering—it functions like the normal value.
VALUES.TITLE: pre

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Sequences of line breaks are collapsed.
VALUES.TITLE: pre-wrap

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: All characters are entered through the IME. Users can still deactivate the IME.
VALUES.TITLE: active

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. IME is not affected. This is the same as not specifying the -ms-ime-mode attribute.
VALUES.TITLE: auto

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: All characters are entered without IME. Users can still activate the IME.
VALUES.TITLE: inactive

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: IME is completely disabled. Users cannot activate the IME if the control has focus.
VALUES.TITLE: disabled

css\/properties\/border-left-style.SUMMARY: Sets the style of an element's left border. To set all four borders, use the shorthand property, border-style. Otherwise, you can set the borders individually with border-top-style, border-right-style, border-bottom-style, border-left-style.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A series of round or square dots.
VALUES.TITLE: dotted

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Looks as if it were carved in the canvas. (This is typically achieved by creating a “shadow” from two colors that are slightly lighter and darker than the border-color.)
VALUES.TITLE: groove

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Border is a double line drawn on top of the background of the object. The sum of the two single lines and the space between equals the border-width value. The border width must be at least 3 pixels wide to draw a double border.
VALUES.TITLE: double

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. Border is not drawn, color and width are ignored. If the border is an image, the image layer counts but is not drawn. See background-image.
VALUES.TITLE: none

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A single line segment.
VALUES.TITLE: solid

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A series of square-ended dashes.
VALUES.TITLE: dashed

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Looks as if the content on the inside of the border is coming out of the canvas.
VALUES.TITLE: outset

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Same as none, except in terms of conflict resolution of collapsed borders. Any element with a hidden border suppresses all shared borders at that location. Borders with a style of none have the lowest priority.
VALUES.TITLE: hidden

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Looks as if the content on the inside of the border is sunken into the canvas.
VALUES.TITLE: inset

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Looks as if it were coming out of the canvas.
VALUES.TITLE: ridge

css\/properties\/margin-right.SUMMARY: margin-right sets the right margin of an element.
css\/properties\/margin-right.INITIALVALUE: Depends on the particular element. Different elements have different default margins.
css\/properties\/margin-right.COMPUTEDVALUE: As specified, but with relative lengths converted into absolute pixel values.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Specifies a fixed length, using any standard CSS length units . Negative Values are allowed.
VALUES.TITLE: length

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The browser calculates a right margin dependent on the space available.
VALUES.TITLE: auto

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Inherits the parent element's specified margin-right width.
VALUES.TITLE: inherit

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A percentage of the width of the containing block. Negative values are allowed. (Even though this is margin-top, the browser will take the percentage from the width, not the height of the containing block.)
VALUES.TITLE: percentage

css\/properties\/overflow.SUMMARY: The overflow property controls how extra text exceeding the bounding box of an element is rendered. The overflow property can be used in conjunction with an element that has a fixed width and height, to eliminate text-induced page distortion.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Content is clipped and scroll bars are added, even if the content does not exceed the dimensions of the object.
VALUES.TITLE: scroll

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Content is clipped and scrolling is added only when necessary.
VALUES.TITLE: auto

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. Content is not clipped and scroll bars are not added.
VALUES.TITLE: visible

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Content that exceeds the dimensions of the object is not shown.
VALUES.TITLE: hidden

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Value of the -ms-scroll-snap-type property.
VALUES.TITLE: -ms-scroll-snap-type

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Value of the -ms-scroll-snap-points-y property.
VALUES.TITLE: -ms-scroll-snap-points-y

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Value of the -ms-scroll-snap-type property.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Value of the -ms-scroll-snap-points-x property.
VALUES.TITLE: -ms-scroll-snap-points-x

css\/properties\/margin-bottom.SUMMARY: margin-bottom sets the bottom margin of an element.
css\/properties\/margin-bottom.INITIALVALUE: Depends on the particular element. Different elements have different default margins.
css\/properties\/margin-bottom.COMPUTEDVALUE: As specified, but with relative lengths converted into absolute pixel values.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Specifies a fixed length, using any standard CSS length units . Negative Values are allowed.
VALUES.TITLE: length

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The browser calculates a bottom margin dependent on the space available
VALUES.TITLE: auto

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Inherits the parent element's specified margin-bottom width.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A percentage of the width of the containing block. Negative values are allowed. (Even though this is margin-bottom, the browser will take the percentage from the width, not the height of the containing block.)

css\/properties\/page-break-after.SUMMARY: The page-break-after property is supported in all major browsers.

VALUES.TITLE: inherit

VALUES.TITLE: left

VALUES.TITLE: always

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Avoid inserting a page break after the element
VALUES.TITLE: avoid

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Insert page breaks after the element until it reaches a blank right page
VALUES.TITLE: right

css\/properties\/mask-box-image-slice.SUMMARY:
This property specifies inward offsets from the top, right, bottom, and left edges of the mask image, dividing it into nine regions: four corners, four edges and a middle. The middle image part is discarded and treated as fully transparent black unless the ‘fill’ keyword is present.

When four values are specified, they set the offsets on the top, right, bottom and left sides in that order. If the left is missing, it is the same as the right; if the bottom is missing, it is the same as the top; if the right is missing, it is the same as the top.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Numbers represent multiples of the corresponding computed ‘border-width’.
VALUES.TITLE: number

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Percentages refer to the size of the mask box image area: the width of the area for horizontal offsets, the height for vertical offsets.
VALUES.TITLE: percentage

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The ‘fill’ keyword, if present, causes the middle part of the mask image to be preserved. (By default it is discarded, i.e., treated as transparent black.)
VALUES.TITLE: fill

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: All <length>s made absolute, otherwise as specified
VALUES.TITLE: length

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: If ‘auto’ is specified then the mask box image width is the intrinsic width or height (whichever is applicable) of the corresponding image slice (see ‘mask-box-image-slice’). If the image does not have the required intrinsic dimension then the corresponding ‘border-width’ is used instead.
VALUES.TITLE: auto

css\/properties\/mask-size.SUMMARY: Specifies the size of the mask images. Follow the 'background-size' property. Allow user to interacts with other comma-separated mask properties from each mask image layer.
css\/properties\/mask-size.COMPUTEDVALUE: for <length> the absolute value, otherwise a percentage.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. See text.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A floating-point number, followed by an absolute units designator (cm, mm, in, pt, or pc) or a relative units designator (em, ex, or px).
VALUES.TITLE: length

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Scale the image, while preserving its intrinsic aspect ratio (if any), to the largest size such that both its width and its height can fit inside the background positioning area.
VALUES.TITLE: contain

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Scale the image, while preserving its intrinsic aspect ratio (if any), to the smallest size such that both its width and its height can completely cover the background positioning area.
VALUES.TITLE: cover

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: An integer, followed by a percent (%). A percentage value is relative to the background positioning area.
VALUES.TITLE: percentage

css\/properties\/text-decoration.SUMMARY:
The text-decoration CSS property is used to set the text formatting to underline, overline, line-through or blink.
underline and overline decorations are positioned under the text, line-through over it.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Each line of text has a line through the middle.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Produces no text decoration.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Each line of text is underlined.

css\/properties\/outline-width.SUMMARY: The outline-width property sets the width of the outline of an element. An outline is a line that is drawn around elements, outside the border edge, to make the element stand out.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Greater than the default width.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Less than the default width.
VALUES.TITLE: thin

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: This is a keyword indicating that the value is inherited from their parent's element calculated value.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The maximum value for the scrollLeft property.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The maximum value for the scrollLeft property is equal to scrollWidth.

css\/properties\/background.SUMMARY:
This background property is a shorthand property for setting the color, position, size, repeat, clip, origin, attachment, and image of the element.

The background- properties provide fundamental styles to an element, such as color, image, and position. CSS3 adds more properties for handling backgrounds, including properties that improve the mobile web experience. Many CSS background- properties can be set, at the same time, with this background property.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Any of the values available to background-attachment property. The default value is scroll.
VALUES.TITLE: <attachment>

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Any of the values available to background-image property. The default value is none.
VALUES.TITLE: <bg-image>

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Any of the values available to background-position property. Otherwise, it is set to its initial value.
VALUES.TITLE: <position> [ / <bg-size> ]?

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Any of the values available to background-color property. The default value is transparent.
VALUES.TITLE: <color>

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Any of the values available to background-repeat property. The default value is repeat.
VALUES.TITLE: <repeat-style>

VALUES.DESCRIPTION:
If one <box> value is present then it sets both background-origin and background-clip to that value. If two values are present, then the first sets background-origin and the second background-clip.

For background-clip, valid values are those available to background-clip property. The default value is border-box. For background-origin, valid values are those available to background-origin property. The default value is padding-box.
VALUES.TITLE: <box>{1,2}

css\/properties\/text-underline-width.SUMMARY: This defines the line width for underline, overline, or line-through of text decorations

css\/properties\/margin.SUMMARY: The margin property is shorthand to allow you to set all four margins of an element at once. Its equivalent longhand properties are margin-top, margin-right, margin-bottom and margin-left. Negative values are also allowed.
css\/properties\/margin.INITIALVALUE: Depends on the particular element. Different elements have different default margins.
css\/properties\/margin.COMPUTEDVALUE: As specified, but with relative lengths converted into absolute pixel values.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION:
auto is replaced by some suitable value by the browser. For example, it can be used for centering of blocks.

div { width:50%; margin:0 auto; } centers the <div> container horizontally.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A percentage relative to the width of the containing block. Negative values are allowed.
VALUES.TITLE: percentage

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Specifies a fixed length, using any standard CSS length units . Negative Values are allowed.

css\/properties\/border-top-left-radius.SUMMARY: Defines the shape of the border of the top-left corner.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Denotes the size of the circle radius or the semi-major and semi-minor axes of the ellipsis. It can be expressed in any unit allowed by the CSS <length> data types. Negative values are invalid.
VALUES.TITLE: length

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Denotes the size of the circle radius, or the semi-major and semi-minor axes of the ellipsis, using percentage values. Percentages for the horizontal axis refer to the width of the box, percentages for the vertical axis refer to the height of the box. Negative values are invalid.
VALUES.TITLE: percentage

css\/properties\/flow-into.SUMMARY: Diverts the selected element's content into a named flow, used to thread content through different layout regions specified by flow-from.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The element's content remains unchanged, and is not diverted to a flow unless an ancestor element specifies it.
VALUES.TITLE: none

VALUES.DESCRIPTION:
String identifier that specifies a named flow into which to divert the element's content. Common keyword values such as none, inherit, default, auto, and initial are invalid flow names, as are element and content:

  • <ident> element: The element keyword explicitly specifies the entire element diverts to the named flow, not just its contents. (This is the default behavior without the keyword.)
  • <ident> content: Adding the content keyword overrides the default behavior described above, diverting only the element's nested content to the named flow.
VALUES.TITLE: <ident>

css\/properties\/animation-duration.SUMMARY: Defines the length of time an animation will take to complete one cycle

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The specified animation will run for one second.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The initial value of 0s means the animation takes no time. When the duration is 0s (or 0ms) animation-fill-mode still applies i.e. an animation filling backwards will show the value of the 0% keyframe during any delay period, while an animation filling forwards will retain the value specified at the 100% keyframe, even if the animation was instantaneous. Also, animation events are still fired.
VALUES.TITLE: 0s

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: animation-duration can specify a comma-separated list of durations; each duration is applied to the corresponding value of animation-name.
VALUES.TITLE: .25s, .5s

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Animation duration can also be specified in milliseconds.
VALUES.TITLE: 150ms

css\/properties\/mask-origin.SUMMARY: For elements rendered as a single box, specifies the mask positioning area. For elements rendered as multiple boxes (e.g., inline boxes on several lines, boxes on several pages) specifies which boxes ‘box-decoration-break’ operates on to determine the mask positioning area(s).

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Positioning relatively to the padding box. (For single boxes ‘0 0’ is the upper left corner of the padding edge; ‘100% 100%’ is the lower right corner.)
VALUES.TITLE: padding-box

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Positioning relatively to the border box respectively painting box for objects without associated layout box.

css\/properties\/page-break-inside.SUMMARY: Sets the page-breaking behavior inside an element.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Inherit the value of the same property for the object's parent.

css\/properties\/text-justify.SUMMARY: The text-justify CSS property offers a fine level of justification control over the enclosed content, allowing for a variety of sophisticated justification models used in different language writing systems.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Justifies lines of ideographic text, and increases or decreases both inter-ideograph and inter-word spacing. This value is typically used for CJK languages.
VALUES.TITLE: inter-ideograph

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. Allows the browser to determine which justification algorithm to apply.
VALUES.TITLE: auto

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Justifies lines of text by elongating characters at chosen points. This form of justification is intended for Arabic script languages.
VALUES.TITLE: kashida

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Aligns text by increasing the space between words. This value's spacing behavior is the fastest way to make all lines of text equal in length. Its justification behavior does not affect the last line of the paragraph. This value is typically used for languages that separate words using spaces, like English or Korean.
VALUES.TITLE: inter-word

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Aligns text by increasing the space between both of words and characters. This value is sometimes used in e.g. Japanese.
VALUES.TITLE: distribute

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Justifies lines of text that contain no inter-word spacing. This value is typically used for Southeast Asian scripts such as Thai.
VALUES.TITLE: inter-cluster

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Justification is disabled.
VALUES.TITLE: none

css\/properties\/empty-cells.SUMMARY: Sets whether or not to display borders and background on empty cells in a table.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Renders empty cells with inherited borders and styles
VALUES.TITLE: show

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Does not render the cell
VALUES.TITLE: hide

css\/properties\/animation-fill-mode.SUMMARY: Controls the state of animated properties before and after an animation

VALUES.DESCRIPTION:
One of the following values: none (default), forwards, backwards, both

none
Property values do not change before the animation starts, and they return to their original state when the animation ends.
forwards
When the animation ends, properties retain the values set by the final keyframe.
backwards
If the animation is delayed by animation-delay, properties assume values set by the first keyframe while waiting for the animation to start. When the animation ends, properties revert to their original state.
both
Values set by the first and last keyframes are applied before and after the animation.
The animation-fill-mode property can be specified on its own, or as a property of the animation element. (See http://docs.webplatform.org/wiki/css/properties/animation/animation )
VALUES.TITLE: single-animation-fill-mode

css\/properties\/column-rule-style.SUMMARY: Specifies the style of the rule between columns. The column-rule-style values are the same as for border-style.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. No column rule is drawn, regardless of any specified column-rule-width. The computed value is set to 0.
VALUES.TITLE: none

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Column rule is a solid line.
VALUES.TITLE: solid

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: 3-D groove is drawn in colors slightly lighter and darker than the value.
VALUES.TITLE: groove

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Column rule is a dashed line.
VALUES.TITLE: dashed

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: 3-D ridge is drawn in colors based on the value.
VALUES.TITLE: ridge

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Same as none.
VALUES.TITLE: hidden

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: 3-D outset is drawn in colors based on the value.
VALUES.TITLE: outset

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Column rule is a dotted line.
VALUES.TITLE: dotted

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Column rule is two parallel solid lines with a space between. The sum of the two single lines and the space between equals the column-rule-width value. The column rule width must be at least 3 pixels wide to draw a double rule.
VALUES.TITLE: double

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: 3-D inset is drawn in colors based on the value.
VALUES.TITLE: inset

css\/properties\/border-right-width.SUMMARY: Sets the width of an element's right border. To set all four borders, use the border-width shorthand property which sets the values simultaneously for border-top-width, border-right-width, border-bottom-width, and border-left-width.
css\/properties\/border-right-width.COMPUTEDVALUE: An absolute length; 0 if the border style is 'none' or 'hidden'

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Less than the default width.
VALUES.TITLE: thin

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default.
VALUES.TITLE: medium

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Floating-point number, followed by an absolute units designator (cm, mm, in, pt, or pc) or a relative units designator (em, ex, or px). For more information about the supported length units, see CSS Values and Units Reference.
VALUES.TITLE: <width>

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Greater than the default width.
VALUES.TITLE: thick

css\/properties\/hanging-punctuation.SUMMARY: If a punctuation mark is present, this property determines if the punctuation mark hangs and whether it can be placed outside the line box and the start or at the end of a line of text.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A stop or comma at the end of a line hangs if it does not otherwise fit prior to justification.
VALUES.TITLE: allow-end

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A stop or comma at the end of a line hangs
VALUES.TITLE: force-end

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: This is a closing bracket or quote of an element at the end of the last formatted line. The element hangs and this applies to any characters in the Unicode categories Pe, Pf, and Pi.
VALUES.TITLE: last

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: No character hangs
VALUES.TITLE: none

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: This is an opening bracket or quote that is at the start of the first formatted line of an element that hangs. Any characters in the Unicode categories Ps, Pf, Pi are applied.
VALUES.TITLE: first

css\/properties\/filter.SUMMARY: Applies various image processing effects. This property is largely unsupported. See Compatibility section for more information.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Any combination of built-in filter functions: blur(), brightness(), contrast(), custom(), drop-shadow(), grayscale(), hue-rotate(), invert(), opacity(), saturate(), and sepia()
VALUES.TITLE: <function>

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A reference to an SVG <filter> element
VALUES.TITLE: url(path/to/filter.svg#filterID)

css\/properties\/border-image.SUMMARY: Shorthand property that defines an image to be displayed and its positioning, instead of a solid color, for 'border' property. It can be used to set border-image-source, border-image-slice, border-image-width, border-image-outset and border-image-repeat, or a subset of these.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION:
The border-image property can contain up to five components:

  • border-image-source: This can take a valid "CSS images: url()" as its value.
  • border-image-slice: This takes any of the values available to the border-image-slice property, which includes <number>, <percentage> and fill. For more details about each, see the border-image-slice page.
  • border-image-width: This takes a numeric value with any of the standard length units.
  • border-image-outset: This takes a numeric value with any of the standard length units.
  • border-image-repeat: This takes any of the type of values available to the border-image-repeat property, which includes stretch, repeat, round and space. For more details about each, see the border-image-repeat page.
VALUES.TITLE: border-image-source border-image-slice border-image-width border-image-outset border-image-repeat

css\/properties\/column-count.SUMMARY: Specifies the number of columns an element should be divided into.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: An integer value that specifies the number of columns in the multi-column element. Values must be greater than 0. When column-width is specified with column-count and both have non-auto values, the integer value defines the maximum number of columns.
VALUES.TITLE: count

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The number of columns is determined by the values of other property values of the multi-column element, such as column-width.
VALUES.TITLE: auto

css\/properties\/ms-scroll-chaining.SUMMARY: Specifies the scrolling behavior that occurs when a user hits the scroll limit during a manipulation.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Initial value. A bounce effect is shown when the user hits a scroll limit during a manipulation.
VALUES.TITLE: none

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The nearest scrollable parent element begins scrolling when the user hits a scroll limit during a manipulation. No bounce effect is shown.
VALUES.TITLE: chained

css\/properties\/text-overline-style.SUMMARY: Specifies the line style for overline text decoration.

css\/properties\/background-image.SUMMARY: Applies one or more background images to an element. These can be any valid CSS image, including url() paths to image files or CSS gradients.
css\/properties\/background-image.COMPUTEDVALUE: As specified, but with URIs made absolute

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: You can apply multiple background images to a single element (image files, gradients, or a mixture) by including all the image references in the property value, with each one separated by a comma. Images referenced earlier in the property value appear in front of images referenced later.
VALUES.TITLE: <image>, <image>, …

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. Color of the next parent through which the background is visible.
VALUES.TITLE: none

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Any valid CSS image value, including image files through CSS images: url() or CSS gradients.
VALUES.TITLE: <image>

css\/properties\/mask-box-image-width.SUMMARY:
The mask image is drawn inside an area called the mask box image area. This is an area whose boundaries by default correspond to the mask box, see ‘mask-box-image-outset’.

The four values of ‘mask-box-image-width’ specify offsets that are used to divide the mask box image area into nine parts. They represent inward distances from the the top, right, bottom, and left sides of the area, respectively. If the left width is missing, it is the same as the right; if the bottom is missing, it is the same as the top; if the right is missing, it is the same as the top.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: If ‘auto’ is specified then the mask box image width is the intrinsic width or height (whichever is applicable) of the corresponding image slice (see ‘mask-box-image-slice’). If the image does not have the required intrinsic dimension then the corresponding ‘border-width’ is used instead.
VALUES.TITLE: auto

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Numbers represent multiples of the corresponding computed ‘border-width’.
VALUES.TITLE: number

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Percentages refer to the size of the mask box image area: the width of the area for horizontal offsets, the height for vertical offsets.
VALUES.TITLE: percentage

css\/properties\/border-image-outset.SUMMARY: The border-image-outset property describes, by which amount the border image area extends beyond the border box.
css\/properties\/border-image-outset.COMPUTEDVALUE: all length made absolute, otherwise as specified

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Is a keyword indicating that all four values are inherited from their parent's element calculated value.
VALUES.TITLE: inherit

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Floating-point number, followed by an absolute units designator (cm, mm, in, pt, or pc) or a relative units designator (em, ex, or px). For more information about the supported length units, see CSS Values and Units Reference (Length). This length must not be negative.
VALUES.TITLE: <length>

css\/properties\/border-right.SUMMARY: Shorthand property that defines the border-width, border-style and border-color of an element's right border in a single declaration. Note that you can use the corresponding longhand properties to set specific individual properties of the right border — border-right-width, border-right-style and border-right-color.
css\/properties\/border-right.INITIALVALUE: For style values, the initial value is none. For color values, the initial value is currentColor.  For width values, the initial value is medium, which is computed as about 3px in most browsers.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION:
The border-right property can contain up to three components:

  • border-width: This takes a numeric value with any of the standard length units.
  • border-style: This takes any of the range of style values available to the border-style property, which includes none, hidden, dotted, dashed, solid, double, groove, ridge, inset, outset. For more details about each, see the border-style page.
  • color: This can take any valid CSS color as its value.
VALUES.TITLE: border-width border-style color

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: When we set the value to inherit, the element will inherit the border values set on its parent.
VALUES.TITLE: inherit

css\/properties\/perspective-origin.SUMMARY: defines where a 3D element is based in the x- and the y-axis.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Second value only. Equal to 100% or the full box height.
VALUES.TITLE: bottom

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: An integer, followed by a %. The value is a percentage of the total box length (for the first value) or the total box height (for the second value, if specified).
VALUES.TITLE: percentage

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: First value only. Equal to 100% or the full box length.
VALUES.TITLE: right

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: First value only. Equal to 50% or half the length of the box.
VALUES.TITLE: center

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: First value only. Equal to 0% or a zero length.
VALUES.TITLE: left

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Second value only. Equal to 50% or a half the height of the box.
VALUES.TITLE: center

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Second value only. Equal to 0% or a zero height.
VALUES.TITLE: top

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A floating-point number, followed by either an absolute units designator (cm, mm, in, pt, or pc) or a relative units designator (em, ex, or px), that indicates the origin of transformation. For more information about the supported length units, see CSS Values and Units.
VALUES.TITLE: length

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Ruby text is evenly distributed across the width of the base if the width of the ruby text is smaller than the width of the base. White space precedes the first and follows the last character in the ruby text, equal to half the kerning of the ruby text. If the width of the ruby text is at least the width of the base, the ruby text is centered.
VALUES.TITLE: distribute-space

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Ruby text is evenly distributed across the width of the base if the width of the ruby text is smaller than the width of the base. If the width of the ruby text is at least the width of the base, the ruby text is center-aligned.
VALUES.TITLE: distribute-letter

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Ruby text is centered if it is not adjacent to a line edge. If it is adjacent to a line edge, the side of the ruby text lines up with the side of the base text.
VALUES.TITLE: line-edge

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Ruby text is right-aligned with the base.
VALUES.TITLE: right

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. Browser determines how the ruby text is aligned. The recommended behavior for an ideographic (Asian character) ruby is to be aligned in the distribute-space mode. The recommended behavior for a Latin character ruby is to be aligned in the center mode.
VALUES.TITLE: auto

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Ruby text is left-aligned with the base.
VALUES.TITLE: left

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Ruby text is centered within the width of the base. If the length of the base is smaller than the length of the ruby text, the base is centered within the width of the ruby text.
VALUES.TITLE: center

css\/properties\/min-height.SUMMARY: Sets the minimum height for an element. It prevents the height of the element to exceed the specified value. It overrides both the height & the max-height property if any them is specified below the min-height value.
css\/properties\/min-height.COMPUTEDVALUE: The percentage as specified or the absolute length

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The narrowest space a box could take while fitting around its contents if none of the soft wrap opportunities within the box were taken.(Space/Punctuation in text are examples of a soft-wrap opportunity). Requires CSS Intrinsic & Extrinsic Sizing Module support in browsers.
VALUES.TITLE: max-content

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: If the total available space is finite, equals to min(max-content, max(min-content, fill-available)). Otherwise, equal to the max-content measure. Requires CSS Intrinsic & Extrinsic Sizing Module support in browsers.
VALUES.TITLE: fit-content

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The narrowest measure a box could take that doesn't lead to inline-dimension overflow that could be avoided by choosing a larger measure. Roughly, the measure that would fit around its contents if all soft wrap opportunities within the box were taken. Requires CSS Intrinsic & Extrinsic Sizing Module support in browsers.
VALUES.TITLE: min-content

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Fill the entire available space of from the containing block (Height minus horizontal margin, border and padding of the containing block). Requires CSS Intrinsic & Extrinsic Sizing Module support in browsers.
VALUES.TITLE: fill-available

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. Behaves as 0 for non-flexbox elements. On flexbox acts as min-content.
VALUES.TITLE: auto

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: See css calc function for mode details.
VALUES.TITLE: calc

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Specifies a fixed height. Negative values are not allowed. See length for possible units.
VALUES.TITLE: length

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Takes the same specified value as the property for the element's parent.
VALUES.TITLE: inherit

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A <percentage> relative to the height of the containing block. If the containing block has no height explicitly set then is is treated as 0. Negative values are not allowed
VALUES.TITLE: percentage

css\/properties\/counter-reset.SUMMARY: The counter-reset property contains a list of one or more names of counters, each one optionally followed by an integer (otherwise, the integer defaults to 0.) Each time the given element is invoked, the counters specified by the property are set to the given integer.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The value to which the counter is set when the element is invoked. The default value is 0.
VALUES.TITLE: integer

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The name of the counter, optionally followed by an integer.
VALUES.TITLE: identifier

css\/properties\/border-top-style.SUMMARY: Sets the style of an element's top border. To set all four borders, use the shorthand property, border-style. Otherwise, you can set the borders individually with border-top-style, border-right-style, border-bottom-style, border-left-style.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Looks as if it were carved in the canvas. (This is typically achieved by creating a “shadow” from two colors that are slightly lighter and darker than the border-color.)
VALUES.TITLE: groove

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Looks as if the content on the inside of the border is coming out of the canvas.
VALUES.TITLE: outset

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A single line segment.
VALUES.TITLE: solid

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Looks as if the content on the inside of the border is sunken into the canvas.
VALUES.TITLE: inset

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A series of square-ended dashes.
VALUES.TITLE: dashed

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. Border is not drawn, color and width are ignored. If the border is an image, the image layer counts but is not drawn. See background-image.
VALUES.TITLE: none

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A series of round or square dots.
VALUES.TITLE: dotted

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Border is a double line drawn on top of the background of the object. The sum of the two single lines and the space between equals the border-width value. The border width must be at least 3 pixels wide to draw a double border.
VALUES.TITLE: double

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Looks as if it were coming out of the canvas.
VALUES.TITLE: ridge
