VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Same as none, except in terms of conflict resolution of collapsed borders. Any element with a hidden border suppresses all shared borders at that location. Borders with a style of none have the lowest priority.
VALUES.TITLE: hidden

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Only a character grid is used. This is recommended for use with block-level elements, such as a blockquote, where the line grid is intended to be disabled.
VALUES.TITLE: char

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Only a line grid is used. This is recommended for use with inline elements, such as a span, to disable the horizontal grid on runs of text that act as a single entity in the grid layout.
VALUES.TITLE: line

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: No grid is used.
VALUES.TITLE: none

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. Both the char and line grid modes are enabled. This setting is necessary to fully enable the layout grid on an element.
VALUES.TITLE: both

css\/properties\/letter-spacing.SUMMARY: The letter-spacing CSS property specifies the spacing behavior between text characters.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The spacing is the normal spacing for the current font.
VALUES.TITLE: normal

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Indicates inter-character space in addition to the default space between characters, followed by an absolute units designator (cm, mm, in, pt, or pc) or a relative units designator (em, ex, or px). Values may be negative, but there may be implementation-specific limits.
VALUES.TITLE: length

css\/properties\/column-width.SUMMARY: Specifies the width of columns in multi-column elements.
css\/properties\/column-width.COMPUTEDVALUE: the absolute length, zero or larger

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A floating-point number, followed by either an absolute units designator (cm, mm, in, pt, or pc) or a relative units designator (em, ex, or px), that indicates the optimal width. For more information about the supported length units, see CSS Length Units Reference.
VALUES.TITLE: length

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. The optimal column width is determined through other property values of the multi-column element, such as columnCount.
VALUES.TITLE: auto

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The object has no rows.
VALUES.TITLE: none

VALUES.DESCRIPTION:
The height of each row specified as one of the following values:

  • A length consisting of an integer number, followed by an absolute units designator (cm, mm, in, pt, or pc) or a relative units designator (em, ex, or px).
  • A percentage of the object height.
  • A weighted proportion of the object height consisting of an integer number, followed by a fractional designator (fr). For example, if 1fr 2fr is specified, the first row is allocated 1/3 of the object height and the second column is allocated 2/3 of the object height.
VALUES.TITLE: height

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The maximum height of any child elements is used as the height of the row.
VALUES.TITLE: max-content

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The minimum height of any child elements is used as the height of the row.
VALUES.TITLE: min-content

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Initial value. The height of a row is computed based on the tallest child element in that column. This keyword is equivalent to minmax(min-content, max-content).
VALUES.TITLE: auto

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The height of the row is between min and max, as available space allows. The min and max parameters can be any other value of the -ms-grid-rows property, except for auto.
VALUES.TITLE: minmax(min, max)

css\/properties\/wrap-option.SUMMARY:
Obsolete and unsupported. Do not use.

This CSS property controls the text when it reaches the end of the block in which it is enclosed.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The text is wrapped after the last character which can fit before the ending-edge of the line and where explicitly specified by preserved line feed characters. No line-breaking algorithm is invoked. The intended usage is the rendering of a character terminal emulation.
VALUES.TITLE: soft-wrap

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The text is wrapped like for the 'wrap' case, except that the line-breaking algorithm will allow as a last resort option a text wrap after the last character which can fit before the ending edge of the line box, independently of 'line-break', 'word-break-cjk' and 'word-break-inside' properties. For example, this addresses the situation of very long words constrained in a fixed-width container with no scrolling allowed.
VALUES.TITLE: emergency

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The text is only wrapped where explicitly specified by preserved line feed characters. In the case when lines are longer than the available block width, the overflow will be treated in accordance with the 'overflow' property specified in the element.
VALUES.TITLE: no-wrap

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The text is wrapped at the best line-breaking opportunity (if required) within the available block inline-progression dimension
VALUES.TITLE: wrap

css\/properties\/text-underline.SUMMARY: The 'text-underline' property is the shorthand for 'text-underline-style', 'text-underline-width', 'text-underline-color', 'text-underline-mode' and 'text-underline-position'.
css\/properties\/text-underline.COMPUTEDVALUE: specified value (except for initial and inherit)

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: This property specifies the line color for the underline.
VALUES.TITLE: text-underline-color

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: This property set the mode for the underline determining whether the text decoration affects the space characters or not. 'Space characters' are all characters classified by the Unicode Standard [UNICODE] as category 'Zs', in addition to the white space characters. Possible values: continuous/skip-white-space
VALUES.TITLE: text-underline-mode

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: This property sets the position of the underline. It can appear either 'before' (above in an horizontal flow) or after (below in an horizontal flow) the run of text in relation to its baseline orientation. This property is typically used in vertical writing context where it may be desired to have the underline appear 'before' the run of text. This results in having the underline appearing on the right side of the vertical writing column. Possible values: auto/before-edge/alphabetic/after-edge
VALUES.TITLE: text-underline-position

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: This property specify the line style for underline. Possible values: none/solid/double/dotted/dashed/dot-dash/dot-dot-dash/wave
VALUES.TITLE: text-underline-style

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: No scroll wheel translation takes place.
VALUES.TITLE: none

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Vertical to horizontal translation, as described in Remarks, will take place when appropriate.
VALUES.TITLE: vertical-to-horizontal

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Initial value. Value is inherited from the element's parent element.
VALUES.TITLE: inherit

css\/properties\/text-decoration-color.SUMMARY: CSS property that sets the color that is used for line-through, underline, overline, or strike-through that is specified by the text-decoration-line. Avoiding using other HTML elements is preferred to the use of this property when coloring the text-decoration-line values.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Accepts variations of keywords and numeric notations.
VALUES.TITLE: color

css\/properties\/border-right-style.SUMMARY: Sets the style of an element's right border. To set all four borders, use the shorthand property, border-style. Otherwise, you can set the borders individually with border-top-style, border-right-style, border-bottom-style, border-left-style.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. Border is not drawn, color and width are ignored. If the border is an image, the image layer counts but is not drawn. See background-image.
VALUES.TITLE: none

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A series of square-ended dashes.
VALUES.TITLE: dashed

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A series of round or square dots.
VALUES.TITLE: dotted

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Border is a double line drawn on top of the background of the object. The sum of the two single lines and the space between equals the border-width value. The border width must be at least 3 pixels wide to draw a double border.
VALUES.TITLE: double

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Looks as if it were carved in the canvas. (This is typically achieved by creating a “shadow” from two colors that are slightly lighter and darker than the border-color.)
VALUES.TITLE: groove

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Same as none, except in terms of conflict resolution of collapsed borders. Any element with a hidden border suppresses all shared borders at that location. Borders with a style of none have the lowest priority.
VALUES.TITLE: hidden

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Looks as if the content on the inside of the border is sunken into the canvas.
VALUES.TITLE: inset

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Looks as if the content on the inside of the border is coming out of the canvas.
VALUES.TITLE: outset

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Looks as if it were coming out of the canvas.
VALUES.TITLE: ridge

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A single line segment.
VALUES.TITLE: solid

css\/properties\/grid-column-span.SUMMARY: See css/properties/grid-column. This property has been removed from the specification.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Integer value that specifies the number of columns to span.
VALUES.TITLE: integer

css\/properties\/text-emphasis.SUMMARY: The text-emphasis property will apply special emphasis marks to the elements text. Slightly similar to the text-decoration property only that this property can have affect on the line-height. It also is noted that this is shorthand for text-emphasis-style and for text-emphasis-color.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: There are no emphasis marks
VALUES.TITLE: none

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Display the given string as marks. Authors should not specify more than one character in <string>. The UA may truncate or ignore strings consisting of more than one grapheme cluster.
VALUES.TITLE: <string>

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Displays large circles as marks
VALUES.TITLE: circle

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Displays small circles as marks
VALUES.TITLE: dot

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Displays double circles as marks
VALUES.TITLE: double-circle

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: It is filled with a solid color
VALUES.TITLE: filled

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The shape has an empty space
VALUES.TITLE: open

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Displays sesames as marks
VALUES.TITLE: sesame

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Displays triangles as marks
VALUES.TITLE: triangle

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The textDecoration property is not set to "blink."
The textDecoration property is set to "blink."

css\/properties\/background-size.SUMMARY: Specifies the size of the background images.
css\/properties\/background-size.COMPUTEDVALUE: for <length> the absolute value, otherwise a percentage

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. See Remarks.
VALUES.TITLE: auto

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Scale the image, while preserving its intrinsic aspect ratio (if any), to the largest size such that both its width and its height can fit inside the background positioning area.
VALUES.TITLE: contain

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Scale the image, while preserving its intrinsic aspect ratio (if any), to the smallest size such that both its width and its height can completely cover the background positioning area.
VALUES.TITLE: cover

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A floating-point number, followed by an absolute units designator (cm, mm, in, pt, or pc) or a relative units designator (em, ex, or px). For more information about the supported length units, see the CSS Values and Units Reference.
VALUES.TITLE: length

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: An integer, followed by a percent (%). A percentage value is relative to the background positioning area.
VALUES.TITLE: percentage

css\/properties\/flex-wrap.SUMMARY: The flex-wrap property controls whether the flex container is single-line or multi-line, and the direction of the cross-axis, which determines the direction in which new lines are stacked.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The flex container is single-line. The cross-start direction is equivalent to either the start or before/head direction of the current writing mode, whichever is in the cross axis, and the cross-end direction is the opposite direction of cross-start.
VALUES.TITLE: nowrap

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Same as wrap, except the cross-start and cross-end directions are swapped.
VALUES.TITLE: wrap-reverse

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The flex container is multi-line. The cross-start direction is equivalent to either the start or before/head direction of the current writing mode, whichever is in the cross axis, and the cross-end direction is the opposite direction of cross-start.
VALUES.TITLE: wrap

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. No character grid is set.
VALUES.TITLE: none

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Largest character in the font of the element is used to set the character grid.
VALUES.TITLE: auto

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Floating-point number, followed by an absolute units designator (cm, mm, in, pt, or pc) or a relative units designator (em, ex, or px). For more information about the supported length units, see CSS Values and Units Reference.
VALUES.TITLE: length

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Integer, followed by a percent sign (%). The value is a percentage derived from the dimensions of the parent object.
VALUES.TITLE: percentage

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Integer value that identifies the specified row.
VALUES.TITLE: integer

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The object has no columns.
VALUES.TITLE: none

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Initial value. The width of a column is computed based on the widest child element in that column. This keyword is equivalent to minmax(min-content, max-content).
VALUES.TITLE: auto

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The maximum width of any child elements is used as the width of the column.
VALUES.TITLE: max-content

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The minimum width of any child elements is used as the width of the column.
VALUES.TITLE: min-content

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The width of the row is between min and max, as available space allows. The min and max parameters can be any other value of the -ms-grid-columns property, except for auto.
VALUES.TITLE: minmax(min, max)

VALUES.DESCRIPTION:
The width of each column specified as one of the following values:

  • A length consisting of an integer number, followed by an absolute units designator (cm, mm, in, pt, or pc) or a relative units designator (em, ex, or px).
  • A percentage of the object width.
  • A weighted proportion of the object width consisting of an integer number, followed by a fractional designator (fr). For example, if 1fr 2fr is specified, the first column is allocated 1/3 of the object width and the second column is allocated 2/3 of the object width.
VALUES.TITLE: width

css\/properties\/box-shadow.SUMMARY: The box-shadow property programmatically creates one or more shadows on the inside or outside of a block level element.
css\/properties\/box-shadow.COMPUTEDVALUE: any length made absolute; any specified color computed; otherwise as specified

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The third length is a blur radius, which can be a number of any length unit. The larger this value, the bigger the blur, meaning the shadow becomes bigger and lighter. Negative values are not allowed. If not specified, it defaults to 0 (the shadow's edge is sharp).
VALUES.TITLE: blur-radius (optional)

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: If not specified (default), the shadow is assumed to be a drop shadow (as if the box were raised above the content). The presence of the inset keyword changes the shadow to one inside the frame (as if the content was depressed inside the box). Inset shadows are drawn inside the border (even transparent ones), above the background, but below content.
VALUES.TITLE: inset (optional)

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The first length is the horizontal offset of the shadow — offset-x specifies the horizontal offset of the shadow, which can be a number of any length unit. Positive values place the shadow to the right of the element, and negative values to the left. If both offset-x and offset-y values are 0, the shadow is placed directly behind the element.
VALUES.TITLE: offset-x (optional)

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: To apply multiple shadows to one element, write the box-shadow values out one after another, separated by commas.
VALUES.TITLE: offset-x offset-y blur-radius color, offset-x offset-y blur-radius color

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The second length is the vertical offset of the shadow — offset-y specifies the vertical offset of the shadow, which can be a number of any length unit. Positive values place the shadow below the element, and negative values above. If both offset-x and offset-y values are 0, the shadow is placed directly behind the element.
VALUES.TITLE: offset-y (optional)

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The fourth length is a spread distance, which again can be a number of any unit. Positive values cause the shadow to expand and grow bigger, negative values cause the shadow to shrink. If not specified, it defaults to 0 (the shadow is the same size as the element). Note that setting the size of an outer shadow to 0 causes it to disappear, whereas a 0-sized inner shadow covers the entire padding-box. For inner shadows, expanding the shadow (creating more shadow area) means contracting the shadow's perimeter shape.
VALUES.TITLE: spread-distance (optional)

css\/properties\/column-rule-width.SUMMARY: Specifies the width of the rule between columns.
css\/properties\/column-rule-width.COMPUTEDVALUE: absolute length; ‘0’ if the column rule style is ‘none’ or ‘hidden’

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. A medium width border.
VALUES.TITLE: medium

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Width greater than the default.
VALUES.TITLE: thick

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Width less than the default.
VALUES.TITLE: thin

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Width consisting of a floating-point number, followed by an absolute units designator (cm, mm, in, pt, or pc) or a relative units designator (em, ex, or px)
VALUES.TITLE: width

css\/properties\/border-spacing.SUMMARY: Sets the distance between the borders of adjacent cells.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A floating-point number, followed by either an absolute units designator (cm, mm, in, pt, or pc) or a relative units designator (em, ex, or px). For more information about the supported length units, see CSS Values and Units Reference.
VALUES.TITLE: length

css\/properties\/outline-offset.SUMMARY: The outline-offset property offsets the outline and draw it beyond the border edge.
css\/properties\/outline-offset.COMPUTEDVALUE: <length> value in absolute units (px or physical).

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Floating-point number, followed by an absolute units designator (cm, mm, in, pt, or pc) or a relative units designator (em, ex, or px). For more information about the supported length units, see CSS Values and Units Reference (Length).
VALUES.TITLE: <length>

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: This is a keyword indicating that the value is inherited from their parent's element calculated value.
VALUES.TITLE: inherit

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A line is not drawn over the text.
VALUES.TITLE: VARIANT_FALSE

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A line is drawn over the text.
VALUES.TITLE: VARIANT_TRUE

css\/properties\/border-right-color.SUMMARY:
Sets the color of an element's right border. This page explains the border-right-color value, but often you will find it more convenient to fix the border's right color as part of a shorthand set, either border-right or border-color.

Colors can be defined several ways. For more information, see Usage.
css\/properties\/border-right-color.INITIALVALUE: color - The value of the 'color' property
css\/properties\/border-right-color.COMPUTEDVALUE: when taken from the 'color' property, the computed value of 'color'; otherwise, as specified

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The computed value of the ‘color’ property. This value can be a basic color keyword, such as red or lavenderblush, a numerical value, an RGB or RGBA value, or an HSL or HSLA value. For more information, see Usage.
VALUES.TITLE: <color>

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The same as ‘color: inherit’, the color value inherited from parent object.
VALUES.TITLE: currentColor

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Fully transparent. This keyword can be considered a shorthand for transparent black, rgba(0,0,0,0), which is its computed value.
VALUES.TITLE: transparent

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: currentColor, the color value inherited from parent object.
VALUES.TITLE: inherit

css\/properties\/visibility.SUMMARY: The visibility property specifies whether the boxes generated by an element are rendered.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: This value causes the entire row or column to be removed from the display, and the space normally taken up by the row or column to be made available for other content. This value is used for row, row group, column, and column group elements. If used on elements other than rows, row groups, columns, or column groups, 'collapse' has the same meaning as 'hidden'.
VALUES.TITLE: collapse

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Object is hidden. The box is invisible (fully transparent, nothing is drawn), but still affects layout. Descendants of the element will be visible if they have visibility:visible.
VALUES.TITLE: hidden

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The element is visible.
VALUES.TITLE: visible

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Takes the same specified value as the property for the element's parent.
VALUES.TITLE: inherit

css\/properties\/box-lines.SUMMARY:
Do not use. This property has been replaced by the flex-wrap property.

Gets or sets a value that specifies whether child elements wrap onto multiple lines or columns based on the space available in the object.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Child elements are wrapped and displayed in successive, parallel rows or columns. The object expands in height or width, perpendicular to the axis defined by the -ms-box-orient property, to accommodate the additional rows or columns.
VALUES.TITLE: multiple

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. All child elements are displayed in a single row or column. The overflow property of the object determines whether the child elements are hidden, clipped, or scrollable.
VALUES.TITLE: single

css\/properties\/text-transform.SUMMARY: The text-transform property controls capitalization effects of an element's text.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. Text is not transformed.
VALUES.TITLE: none

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Transforms the first character of each word to uppercase.
VALUES.TITLE: capitalize

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Transforms all the characters to lowercase.
VALUES.TITLE: lowercase

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Transforms all the characters to uppercase.
VALUES.TITLE: uppercase

css\/properties\/border-image-repeat.SUMMARY: The border-image-repeat CSS property defines how the middle part of a border image is handled to match the size of the border. It has a one-value syntax which describes the behavior for all sides, and a two-value syntax that sets a different value for the horizontal and vertical behavior.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Is a keyword indicating that the image will be repeated until it fit the gap between the borders
VALUES.TITLE: repeat

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Is a keyword indicating that the image will be repeated until it fit the gap between the borders. If it doesn't fit after having being repeated an integer number of times, it is rescaled to do so.
VALUES.TITLE: round

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Is a keyword indicating that the image will be repeated until it fit the gap between the borders. If it doesn't fit after having being repeated a whole number of times, the white space is distributed around the tiles.
VALUES.TITLE: space

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Is a keyword indicating that the image will be stretched to fit the gap between the borders.
VALUES.TITLE: stretch

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Is a keyword indicating that all four values are inherited from their parent's element calculated value.
VALUES.TITLE: inherit

css\/properties\/text-underline-position.SUMMARY: This property will add a underline position value to the element that has an underline defined.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The underline is positioned relative to the alphabetic baseline. In this case the underline is likely to cross some descenders. Decoration appears below the text.
VALUES.TITLE: alphabetic

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Decoration appears above the text.
VALUES.TITLE: auto

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: In vertical writing modes, the underline is aligned as for ‘under’, except it is always aligned to the left edge of the text. If this causes the underline to be drawn on the "over" side of the text, then an overline also switches sides and is drawn on the "under" side.
VALUES.TITLE: left

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: In vertical writing modes, the underline is aligned as for ‘under’, except it is always aligned to the right edge of the text. If this causes the underline to be drawn on the "over" side of the text, then an overline also switches sides and is drawn on the "under" side.
VALUES.TITLE: right

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The underline is positioned under the element's text content. In this case the underline usually does not cross the descenders. (This is sometimes called "accounting" underline.) This value can be combined with ‘left’ or ‘right’ if a particular side is preferred in vertical writing modes.
VALUES.TITLE: under

css\/properties\/right.SUMMARY: Specifies the position an element in relation to the right side of the containing element.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. Position is determined by the regular HTML layout of the page.
VALUES.TITLE: auto

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Floating-point number, followed by an absolute units designator (cm, mm, in, pt, or pc) or a relative units designator (em, ex, or px). For more information about the supported length units, see CSS Values and Units Reference.
VALUES.TITLE: length

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Integer, followed by a percent sign (%). The value is a percentage of the width of the parent object.
VALUES.TITLE: percentage

css\/properties\/direction.SUMMARY: The direction CSS property specifies the text direction/writing direction. The rtl is used for Hebrew or Arabic text, the ltr is for other languages.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. Content flows left to right.
VALUES.TITLE: ltr

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Content flows right to left.
VALUES.TITLE: rtl

css\/properties\/border-image-width.SUMMARY: The border-image-width CSS property defines the offset to use for dividing the border image in nine parts, the top-left corner, central top edge, top-right-corner, central right edge, bottom-right corner, central bottom edge, bottom-left corner, and central right edge. They represent inward distance from the top, right, bottom, and left edges.
css\/properties\/border-image-width.COMPUTEDVALUE: all length made absolute, or as specified

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Represents the length of the image slice. It can be an absolute or relative length. This length must not be negative.
VALUES.TITLE: <length>

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Represents a multiple of the computed value of the element's border-width property to be used as the image slice size. The number must not be negative.
VALUES.TITLE: <number>

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Represents the percentage of the image slice relative to the height, or width, of the border image area. The percentage must not be negative.
VALUES.TITLE: <percentage>

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Indicates that the width, or height, of the image size must be the intrinsic size of that dimension.
VALUES.TITLE: auto

css\/properties\/background-repeat.SUMMARY: Background-repeat defines if and how background images will be repeated after they have been sized and positioned
css\/properties\/background-repeat.COMPUTEDVALUE: A list, each item consisting of two keywords, one per dimension

VALUES.DESCRIPTION:
Keyword(s) indicating the repeat pattern.

repeat
Default. In CSS2.1, the image is repeated horizontally and vertically. In CSS3, if two keywords are used, the image is repeated along the relevant axis.
no-repeat
The image is not repeated.
repeat-x
The image is repeated along the horizontal axis.
repeat-y
The image is repeated along the vertical axis.
round
The image is repeated as often as will fit into the background area, and is rescaled if necessary to make it fit a whole number of times. (CSS3)
space
The image is repeated as often as will fit into the background area a whole number of times, and is spaced out so that the first and last ones touch the edges. (CSS3)
VALUES.TITLE: <repeat-style>

css\/properties\/shape-margin.SUMMARY: Set the value that is used to offset the inner wrap shape from other shapes. Inline content that intersects a shape with this property will be pushed by this shape's margin.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The value that is used to offset the inner wrap shape from other shapes.
VALUES.TITLE: <length>

css\/properties\/break-inside.SUMMARY: Control page/column/region breaks that fall within a block of content

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. A page/column/region break is determined by the flow of content.
VALUES.TITLE: auto

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A column break is not allowed within the content block.
VALUES.TITLE: avoid-column

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A page break is not allowed within the content block.
VALUES.TITLE: avoid-page

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A region break is not allowed within the content block.
VALUES.TITLE: avoid-region

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A page/column/region break is not allowed within the content block.
VALUES.TITLE: avoid

css\/properties\/animation-play-state.SUMMARY: Controls whether an animation is running or paused

VALUES.DESCRIPTION:
running (default) or paused

running
Plays the animation. If restarting a paused animation, the animation resumes from the current (paused) property value.
paused
Pauses the animation. The object is displayed with the current property value until animation-play-state is set to running and the animation resumes.
VALUES.TITLE: single-animation-play-state

css\/properties\/perspective.SUMMARY: Defines how far an element is placed from the view on the z-axis.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default.
VALUES.TITLE: none

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The distance the element is places on the z-axis. Lengths must be positive
VALUES.TITLE: [[css/data_types/length|<length>]]

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. Content in the object flows from left to right, and the next horizontal line is positioned underneath the previous line. This layout is used in most Roman-based documents.
VALUES.TITLE: horizontal

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Content in the object flows from top to bottom, and the next vertical line appears to the left of the previous one. This layout is used in East Asian typography.
VALUES.TITLE: vertical-ideographic

css\/properties\/text-align.SUMMARY: The text-align CSS property describes how inline content like text is aligned in its parent block element. text-align does not control the alignment of block elements itself, only their inline content.
css\/properties\/text-align.INITIALVALUE: start, or a nameless value that acts as left if direction is ltr, right if direction is rtl, if start is not supported by the browser.
css\/properties\/text-align.COMPUTEDVALUE: as specified, except for the match-parent value which is calculated against its parent's direction value and results in a computed value of either left or right

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The first occurrence of the one-char string is the element used for alignment. the keyword that follows or precedes it indicates how it is aligned. This allows to align numeric values on the decimal point, for instance.
VALUES.TITLE: <string>

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The inline contents are centered within the line box.
VALUES.TITLE: center

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The same as right if direction is left-to-right and left if direction is right-to-left.
VALUES.TITLE: end

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The text is justified. Text should line up their left and right edges to the left and right content edges of the paragraph.
VALUES.TITLE: justify

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The inline contents are aligned to the left edge of the line box.
VALUES.TITLE: left

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Similar to inherit with the difference that the value start and end are calculated according the parent's direction and are replaced by the adequate left or right value.
VALUES.TITLE: match-parent

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The inline contents are aligned to the right edge of the line box.
VALUES.TITLE: right

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Specifies start alignment of the first line and any line immediately after a forced line break; and end alignment of any remaining lines not affected by text-align-last.
VALUES.TITLE: start end

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The same as left if direction is left-to-right and right if direction is right-to-left.
VALUES.TITLE: start

css\/properties\/columns.SUMMARY: This property is a shorthand property for setting column-width or column-count. Omitted values are set to their initial value of auto.
css\/properties\/columns.COMPUTEDVALUE: The absolute length, zero or larger

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Any of the values available to column-count property. The default value is auto.
VALUES.TITLE: column-count

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Any of the values available to column-width property. The default value is auto.
VALUES.TITLE: column-width

css\/properties\/border-corner-shape.SUMMARY: Specifies different corner clipping effects, such as scoop (inner curves), bevel (straight cuts) or notch (cut-off rectangles). Works along with border-radius to specify the size of each corner effect.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Border radii define a diagonal slice at the corner.
VALUES.TITLE: bevel

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Border radii define a convex curve at the corner (default behavior of border-radius).
VALUES.TITLE: curve

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Border radii define a concave rectangular notch at the corner.
VALUES.TITLE: notch

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Border radii define a concave curve at the corner (informally called "negative border-radius")
VALUES.TITLE: scoop

css\/properties\/top.SUMMARY: This property specifies how far an absolutely positioned box's top margin edge is offset below the top edge of the box's containing block. For relatively positioned boxes, the offset is with respect to the top edges of the box itself (i.e., the box is given a position in the normal flow, then offset from that position according to these properties).
css\/properties\/top.COMPUTEDVALUE: If specified as a length, the corresponding absolute length; if specified as a percentage, the specified value; otherwise, 'auto'.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: For non-replaced elements, the effect of this value depends on which of related properties have the value 'auto' as well. See the sections on the width and height of absolutely positioned, non-replaced elements for details. For replaced elements, the effect of this value depends only on the intrinsic dimensions of the replaced content. See the sections on the width and height of absolutely positioned, replaced elements for details
VALUES.TITLE: auto

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The offset is a fixed distance from the reference edge. Negative values are allowed. For more information about the supported length units, see CSS Values and Units Reference.
VALUES.TITLE: length

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The offset is a percentage of the containing block's width (for 'left' or 'right') or height (for 'top' and 'bottom'). Negative values are allowed.
VALUES.TITLE: percentage

css\/properties\/animation-name.SUMMARY: Defines the list of animations that apply to the element

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: No animation applies to the element. This is the initial value of the property.
VALUES.TITLE: none

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: One or more comma-separated animation names. Each name is used to select the @keyframes rule that defines the animation. If the specified name does not match any @keyframes rule then no animation will be run for this name. In addition, when multiple animations update the same property the animation closest to the end of the list wins.
VALUES.TITLE: <single-animation-name> [, <single-animation-name>]*

css\/properties\/transition-duration.SUMMARY: The 'transition-duration' property specifies the length of time a transition animation takes to complete.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Floating-point number, followed by a time units designator (ms or s). For more information about the supported time units, see CSS Values and Units Reference.
VALUES.TITLE: time

css\/properties\/list-style-type.SUMMARY: Specifies the type of list-item marker in a list.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: No marker is shown
VALUES.TITLE: none

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The marker is traditional Armenian numbering
VALUES.TITLE: armenian

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: circle
VALUES.TITLE: circle

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: number with leading zeros (01, 02, 03, etc.)
VALUES.TITLE: decimal-leading-zero

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: number. This is default for <ol>
VALUES.TITLE: decimal

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: filled circle. This is default for <ul>
VALUES.TITLE: disc

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: traditional Georgian numbering
VALUES.TITLE: georgian

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: lower-alpha (a, b, c, d, e, etc.)
VALUES.TITLE: lower-alpha

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: lower-greek
VALUES.TITLE: lower-greek

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: lower-latin (a, b, c, d, e, etc.)
VALUES.TITLE: lower-latin

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: lower-roman (i, ii, iii, iv, v, etc.)
VALUES.TITLE: lower-roman

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: square
VALUES.TITLE: square

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: upper-alpha (A, B, C, D, E, etc.)
VALUES.TITLE: upper-alpha

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: upper-latin (A, B, C, D, E, etc.)
VALUES.TITLE: upper-latin

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: upper-roman (I, II, III, IV, V, etc.)
VALUES.TITLE: upper-roman

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The value of the listStyleType property is inherited from parent element
VALUES.TITLE: inherit

css\/properties\/margin-left.SUMMARY: margin-left sets the left margin of an element.
css\/properties\/margin-left.INITIALVALUE: Depends on the particular element. Different elements have different default margins.
css\/properties\/margin-left.COMPUTEDVALUE: As specified, but with relative lengths converted into absolute pixel values.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The browser calculates a left margin dependent on the space available.
VALUES.TITLE: auto

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Specifies a fixed length, using any standard CSS length units . Negative Values are allowed.
VALUES.TITLE: length

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A percentage of the width of the containing block. Negative values are allowed. (Even though this is margin-top, the browser will take the percentage from the width, not the height of the containing block.)
VALUES.TITLE: percentage

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Inherits the parent element's specified margin-left width.
VALUES.TITLE: inherit

css\/properties\/grid-column.SUMMARY: Grid column provides a shorthand for "grid-column-start" and "grid-column-end." It sets an item's column positioning on a grid defined by "display: grid;"

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Integer or string value that identifies the specified column.
VALUES.TITLE: <integer> || <string>

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Automatically places an item using the auto-placement algorithm.
VALUES.TITLE: auto

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Places an item with contiguous space available to the <integer> value. Using the <string> value only considers lines with that name.
VALUES.TITLE: span && <integer> || <string>

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Ruby text overhangs only text adjacent to its base.
VALUES.TITLE: none

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. Ruby text overhangs any other text adjacent to the base text.
VALUES.TITLE: auto

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Ruby text overhangs only white-space characters.
VALUES.TITLE: whitespace

css\/properties\/list-style-image.SUMMARY: Replaces the list-item marker with an image.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. No image is specified.
VALUES.TITLE: none

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Location of the image, where path/to/image.png is an absolute or relative URL. More details can be found at the css/functions/url() section.
VALUES.TITLE: url(path/to/image.png)

css\/properties\/background-attachment.SUMMARY: Defines if a background image scrolls with the content or stays fixed.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Background image stays fixed within the viewport and does not move when the element or the page is scrolled.
VALUES.TITLE: fixed

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Background image stays fixed with regard to the element’s contents and scrolls as the element is scrolled.
VALUES.TITLE: local

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. Background image scrolls with the object as the document is scrolled.
VALUES.TITLE: scroll

css\/properties\/animation.SUMMARY: Shorthand to define a CSS animation, setting all parameters at once.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION:
A space-separated list of values for each of the individual animation properties. The animation name and duration are required. All other values are optional.

<single-animation-name>
Value of the animation-name property.
<single-animation-duration>
Value of the animation-duration property.
<single-animation-timing-function>
Value of the animation-timing-function property.
<single-animation-delay>
Value of the animation-delay property.
<single-animation-iteration-count>
Value of the animation-iteration-count property.
<single-animation-direction>
Value of the animation-direction property.
<single-animation-fill-mode>
Value of the animation-fill-mode property.

Note The first <time> value is assigned to the animation-duration. The second <time> value is assigned to the animation-delay.
VALUES.TITLE: single-animation

css\/properties\/region-fragment.SUMMARY: Controls whether the last region in a chain displays additional 'overset' content according its default overflow property, or if it displays a fragment of content as if it were flowing into a subsequent region.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Region element displays overset content according to its overflow property.
VALUES.TITLE: auto

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Region element overrides overflow property, displaying whatever fragment of overset content can fit within the region.
VALUES.TITLE: break

css\/properties\/box-line-progression.SUMMARY:
Do not use. This property has been replaced by the flex-wrap property.

Gets or sets a value that specifies the direction to add successive rows or columns when the value of box-lines is set to multiple.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. Successive rows or columns of child elements flow in the direction specified by the writing-mode and -ms-box-lines properties.
VALUES.TITLE: normal

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Successive rows or columns of child elements flow in the reverse direction specified by the writing-mode and box-lines properties.
VALUES.TITLE: reverse

css\/properties\/break-before.SUMMARY: Control page/column/region breaks that fall above a block of content

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A page break is inserted (forced) before the content block.
VALUES.TITLE: always

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. A page break or column break is determined by the flow of content.
VALUES.TITLE: auto

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A column break is not allowed before the content block.
VALUES.TITLE: avoid-column

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A page break is not allowed before the content block.
VALUES.TITLE: avoid-page

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A region break is not allowed before the content block.
VALUES.TITLE: avoid-region

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A page/column/region break is not allowed before the content block.
VALUES.TITLE: avoid

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A column break is inserted (forced) before the content block.
VALUES.TITLE: column

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A page break is inserted (forced) before the content block such that the flow of content continues in the first column of the "left" page that immediately follows the current page (according to the paging format of the document).
VALUES.TITLE: left

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A page break is inserted (forced) before the content block such that the flow of content continues in the first column of the page that immediately follows the current page (according to the paging format of the document).
VALUES.TITLE: page

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A region break is inserted (forced) before the content block.
VALUES.TITLE: region

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A page break is inserted (forced) before the content block such that the flow of content continues in the first column of the "right" page that immediately follows the current page (according to the paging format of the document).
VALUES.TITLE: right

css\/properties\/flow-from.SUMMARY: Flows content from a named flow (specified by a corresponding flow-into) through selected elements to form a dynamic chain of layout regions.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: This container is not a region. Keeps element as is, and does not transform it into a region and replace its content.
VALUES.TITLE: none

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Identifier that replaces content from specified named flow, flowing it from one region element to another.
VALUES.TITLE: <ident>

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The minimum value for the scrollTop property. If the value is negative, then zero is used.
VALUES.TITLE: length

css\/properties\/background-position-x.SUMMARY: Sets the horizontal position of a background image.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Horizontal alignment value (e.g. "left", "right", or "center").
VALUES.TITLE: hAlignment

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Floating-point number, followed by an absolute units designator (cm, mm, in, pt, or pc) or a relative units designator (em, ex, or px). For more information about the supported length units, see CSS Values and Units Reference.
VALUES.TITLE: length

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Integer, followed by a percent sign (%). The value is a percentage of the width or height of the object.
VALUES.TITLE: percentage

css\/properties\/background-position-y.SUMMARY: Sets vertical starting position of a background image.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Floating-point number, followed by an absolute units designator (cm, mm, in, pt, or pc) or a relative units designator (em, ex, or px). For more information about the supported length units, see CSS Values and Units Reference.
VALUES.TITLE: length

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Integer, followed by a percent sign (%). The value is a percentage of the width or height of the object.
VALUES.TITLE: percentage

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Vertical alignment value.
VALUES.TITLE: vAlignment

css\/properties\/display.SUMMARY: Specifies the type of rendering box used for an element.
css\/properties\/display.COMPUTEDVALUE: As specified, except for root element, floated elements, and absolutely positioned elements (see below).

VALUES.DESCRIPTION:
Turns off the display of an element so that the element has no effect on layout; all descendant elements also have their display turned off. The element is removed from the document, and the document is rendered as though the element does not exist, though it may still be in the HTML.

To render an element box's dimensions, yet have its contents be invisible, set the visibility property to hidden.
VALUES.TITLE: none

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Generates a block element box. This is a basic value in CSS 1.
VALUES.TITLE: block

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Behaves like an block element for laying out content in the flexbox model. This is a flexbox model value in CSS3. See flex.
VALUES.TITLE: flex

VALUES.DESCRIPTION:
Behaves like a block element for laying out content in the grid model.

Note: At the time of this writing, most modern browsers do not support this property. This is a grid box model value (an experimental tag in CSS 3.0). See grid.
VALUES.TITLE: grid

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The element generates a block element box that flows with surrounding content as if it were a single inline box--and behaves like a replaced element. This is a basic value in CSS 2.1.
VALUES.TITLE: inline-block

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Behaves like an inline element for laying out content in the flexbox model. This is a flexbox model value in CSS3. See flex.
VALUES.TITLE: inline-flex

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Behaves like an inline element for laying out content in the grid model. This is a grid box model value (an experimental tag in CSS 3.0). See grid.
VALUES.TITLE: inline-grid

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The inline-table value does not have a direct mapping in HTML. It behaves like a <table> HTML element, but as an inline box, rather than a block-level box. Inside the table box is a block-level context. This is a table model value in CSS 2.1.
VALUES.TITLE: inline-table

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: An element set to inline generates one or more inline element boxes.
VALUES.TITLE: inline

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Generates a block box for the content and a separate list-item. This is a basic value in CSS 1.
VALUES.TITLE: list-item

VALUES.DESCRIPTION:
The behavior depends on the following conditions:

  • If the run-in box contains a block box, same as block.
  • If a block box follows the run-in box, the run-in box becomes the first inline box of the block box.
  • If an inline box follows, the run-in box becomes a block box.
VALUES.TITLE: run-in

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Behaves like the <caption> HTML element. This is a table model value in CSS 2.1.
VALUES.TITLE: table-caption

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Behaves like the <td> HTML element. This is a table model value in CSS 2.1.
VALUES.TITLE: table-cell

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Behaves like the <colgroup> HTML element. This is a table model value in CSS 2.1.
VALUES.TITLE: table-column-group

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Behaves like the <col> HTML element. This is a table model value in CSS 2.1.
VALUES.TITLE: table-column

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Behaves like the <tfoot> HTML element. This is a table model value in CSS 2.1.
VALUES.TITLE: table-footer-group

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Behaves like the corresponding <thead> HTML element. This is a table model value in CSS 2.1.
VALUES.TITLE: table-header-group

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Behaves like the <tbody> HTML element. This is a table model value in CSS 2.1.
VALUES.TITLE: table-row-group

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Behaves like the <tr> HTML element. This is a table model value in CSS 2.1.
VALUES.TITLE: table-row

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Behaves like the <table> HTML element. It defines a block-level box. This is a table model value in CSS 2.1.
VALUES.TITLE: table

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: By default, the CSS display property is not inherited ("Inherited: no"). However, when the inherited property has been specified on an element ("Inherited: Yes"), the element uses the computed value of that property on its parent element. Only the root element of the document gets the initial value given in the property's summary.
VALUES.TITLE: inherit

css\/properties\/mask-repeat.SUMMARY: The "mask-repeat property" specifies whether a mask image is repeated (tiled), and how is repeated (round, space etc.).
css\/properties\/mask-repeat.COMPUTEDVALUE: A list, each item consisting of: two keywords, one per dimension

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The repeating behavior of the mask. Single values for <repeat-style> are listed as follows: ‘repeat-x’ : the tiling of the mask object will occur in x direction. ‘repeat-y’: the tiling of the mask object will occur in y direction. ‘repeat’: the tiling of the mask object will occur as often as needed to cover the background area. ‘space’: ‘round’ ‘no-repeat’
VALUES.TITLE: <repeat-style>

css\/properties\/text-overline-color.SUMMARY: Specifies the line color for the overline text decoration.

css\/properties\/box-ordinal-group.SUMMARY:
Do not use. This property has been replaced by flex-order.

Specifies the ordinal group that a child element of the object belongs to. This ordinal value identifies the display order (along the axis defined by the box-orient property) for the group.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Integer value that identifies the group that a child element belongs to.
VALUES.TITLE: integer

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Property is not set to none.
VALUES.TITLE: VARIANT_FALSE

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Property is set to none.
VALUES.TITLE: VARIANT_TRUE

css\/properties\/transition.SUMMARY: The transition CSS property is a shorthand property for transition-property, transition-duration, transition-timing-function, and transition-delay. It allows to define the transition between two states of an element.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Value of the transition-delay property.
VALUES.TITLE: transition-delay

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Value of the transition-duration property.
VALUES.TITLE: transition-duration

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Value of the transition-property property.
VALUES.TITLE: transition-property

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Value of the transition-timing-function property.
VALUES.TITLE: transition-timing-function

css\/properties\/outline.SUMMARY:
The CSS outline property is a shorthand property for setting one or more of the individual outline properties outline-style, outline-width and outline-color in a single rule. In most cases the use of this shortcut is preferable and more convenient.

Outlines differ from borders in the following ways:

  • Outlines do not take up space, they are drawn above the content.
  • Outlines may be non-rectangular. They are rectangular in Gecko/Firefox. Internet Explorer attempts to place the smallest contiguous outline around all elements or shapes that are indicated to have an outline. Opera draws a non-rectangular shape around a construct.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION:
The outline property can contain up to three components:

  • outline-color: This can take any valid CSS color as its value.
  • outline-style: This takes any of the range of style values available to the outline-style property, which includes none, dotted, dashed, solid, double, groove, ridge, inset, outset. For more details about each, see the outline-style page.
  • outline-width: This takes a numeric value with any of the standard length units.
VALUES.TITLE: outline-color outline-style outline-width

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: This is a keyword indicating that the value is inherited from their parent's element calculated value.
VALUES.TITLE: inherit

css\/properties\/grid-definition-columns.SUMMARY:
This property can specify the length, a percentage of the grid container’s size, a measurement of the contents occupying the column, or a fraction of the free space in the grid. You can also specify a range using minmax(), which combines any of these measurements to define a min and max size for the column.

As well as referring to grid lines by their numerical index, you can also name lines. Names can make the grid-placement properties easier to understand and maintain. Lines can have multiple names, such as 'first' and 'header'.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: No initial grid; any columns are implicitly generated with their size determined by the ‘grid-auto-columns’ property.
VALUES.TITLE: none

VALUES.DESCRIPTION:
The track-list syntax is:

<track-list> = [ <string>* [ <track-size> | <repeat-function> ] ]+ <string>*

<track-size> = minmax( <track-breadth> , <track-breadth> ) | auto | <track-breadth>

<track-breadth> = <length> | <percentage> | <flex> | min-content | max-content

Where the values are described as:

  • <length>
  • <percentage>: Percentage values are relative to the grid container width in grid column tracks. If the grid container measure is an indefinite size, <percentage> values relative to that size are treated as ‘auto’.
  • <flex>: A non-negative dimension with the unit "fr". Each <flex> value takes a share of the remaining space in proportion to its value. See Flexible Lengths for more details.
  • max-content: Largest max size contribution of the grid items occupying the grid track.
  • min-content: Largest min size contribution of the grid items occupying the grid track.
  • minmax(min, max): Defines a size range greater than or equal to min and less than or equal to max. If max < min, then max is ignored and ‘minmax(min,max)’ is treated as min.
  • auto: Computes to ‘minmax(min-content, max-content)’.
VALUES.TITLE: <track-list>

css\/properties\/font-variant.SUMMARY: The font-variant property enables you to select the small-caps font within a font family.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Selects a font that is not a 'small-caps' font, usually the available 'normal' font.
VALUES.TITLE: normal

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Selects a 'small-caps' font. If not small caps variant is available, the browser generates a small caps approximation.
VALUES.TITLE: small-caps

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Inherits the font-variant setting from its parent.
VALUES.TITLE: inherit

css\/properties\/outline-style.SUMMARY: The outline-style property sets the style of the outline of an element. An outline is a line that is drawn around elements, outside the border edge, to make the element stand out.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. Outline is not drawn, color and width are ignored.
VALUES.TITLE: none

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A series of square-ended dashes.
VALUES.TITLE: dashed

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A series of round or square dots.
VALUES.TITLE: dotted

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Outline is a double line drawn on top of the background of the object. The sum of the two single lines and the space between equals the outline-width value. The border width must be at least 3 pixels wide to draw a double outline.
VALUES.TITLE: double

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Looks as if it were carved in the canvas. (This is typically achieved by creating a “shadow” from two colors that are slightly lighter and darker than the outline-color.)
VALUES.TITLE: groove

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Looks as if the content on the inside of the outline is sunken into the canvas.
VALUES.TITLE: inset

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Looks as if the content on the inside of the outline is coming out of the canvas.
VALUES.TITLE: outset

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Looks as if it were coming out of the canvas.
VALUES.TITLE: ridge

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A single line segment.
VALUES.TITLE: solid

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: This is a keyword indicating that the value is inherited from their parent's element calculated value.
VALUES.TITLE: inherit

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. Child elements are flattened using orthographic projection into the 2-D plane of the object.
VALUES.TITLE: flat

css\/properties\/flex-shrink.SUMMARY: The flex-shrink CSS property specifies how much a flex item will be reduced with respect to the other items in the flex container to fit within a reduced container.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The flex shrink factor, which describes the proportion by which the flex item will shrink relative to the other flex items in the container. Negative numbers are invalid.
VALUES.TITLE: number

css\/properties\/text-overflow-ellipsis.SUMMARY: The text-overflow-ellipsis CSS property controls how the hint on overflowed content that is not displayed is signaled to the users. The presence of the hint is controlled with CSS property text-overflow-mode. Shorthand property is text-overflow.
css\/properties\/text-overflow-ellipsis.COMPUTEDVALUE: specified value (except for initial and inherit)

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The value is defined either as a string like the default UTF-8 character 'U+2026' or a URI and represents the ellipsis of text-overflow-mode property. If the value is defined as a URI it displays the image behind the URL. You can also set both values which then means they determine the overflow visual hint at the end and the hint after the element box. The latter visual hint is only displayed if there is clipped content because of the dimension limitation on the element block.
VALUES.TITLE: string

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. Ruby text is positioned above the base text.
VALUES.TITLE: above

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Ruby text is positioned inline with the base text.
VALUES.TITLE: inline

css\/properties\/border-left.SUMMARY: Shorthand property that defines the border-width, border-style and border-color of an element's left border in a single declaration. Note that you can use the corresponding longhand properties to set specific individual properties of the left border — border-left-width, border-left-style and border-left-color.
css\/properties\/border-left.INITIALVALUE: For style values, the initial value is none. For color values, the initial value is currentColor.  For width values, the initial value is medium, which is computed as about 3px in most browsers.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION:
The border-left property can contain up to three components:

  • border-width: This takes a numeric value with any of the standard length units.
  • border-style: This takes any of the range of style values available to the border-style property, which includes none, hidden, dotted, dashed, solid, double, groove, ridge, inset, outset. For more details about each, see the border-style page.
  • color: This can take any valid CSS color as its value.
VALUES.TITLE: border-width border-style color

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: When we set the value to inherit, the element will inherit the border values set on its parent.
VALUES.TITLE: inherit

css\/properties\/border-bottom-width.SUMMARY: Sets the width of an element's bottom border. To set all four borders, use the border-width shorthand property which sets the values simultaneously for border-top-width, border-right-width, border-bottom-width, and border-left-width.
css\/properties\/border-bottom-width.COMPUTEDVALUE: An absolute length; 0 if the border style is 'none' or 'hidden'

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Floating-point number, followed by an absolute units designator (cm, mm, in, pt, or pc) or a relative units designator (em, ex, or px). For more information about the supported length units, see CSS Values and Units Reference.
VALUES.TITLE: <width>

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default.
VALUES.TITLE: medium

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Greater than the default width.
VALUES.TITLE: thick

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Less than the default width.
VALUES.TITLE: thin

css\/properties\/text-overflow-mode.SUMMARY: The text-overflow-mode CSS property controls the presence and position of the hint on overflowed content that is not displayed is signaled to the users. The constitution of the hint is controlled with CSS property text-overflow-ellipsis. Shorthand property is text-overflow.
css\/properties\/text-overflow-mode.COMPUTEDVALUE: specified value (except for initial and inherit)

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. Simply clips the content and does not display ellipsis for text-overflow.
VALUES.TITLE: clip

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Display ellipsis (...) for text overflow after the last word that entirely fits into a line.
VALUES.TITLE: ellipsis-word

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Display ellipsis (...) for text overflow after the last letter that entirely fits into a line.
VALUES.TITLE: ellipsis

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. No grid line is set.
VALUES.TITLE: none

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Largest character in the font of the element is used to set the character grid.
VALUES.TITLE: auto

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Floating-point number, followed by an absolute units designator (cm, mm, in, pt, or pc) or a relative units designator (em, ex, or px). For more information about the supported length units, see CSS Values and Units Reference.
VALUES.TITLE: length

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Integer, followed by a percent sign (%). The value is a percentage derived from the dimensions of the parent object.
VALUES.TITLE: percentage

css\/properties\/word-wrap.SUMMARY: Defines whether to break words when the content exceeds the boundaries of its container. The css/properties/word-wrap property is an alternate name for the css/properties/overflow-wrap property.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Content wraps to next line, and a word-break occurs when necessary.
VALUES.TITLE: break-word

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. Content exceeds the boundaries of its container.
VALUES.TITLE: normal

css\/properties\/block-progression.SUMMARY: Sets or retrieves the block progression and layout orientation..

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Bottom-to-top block flow. Layout is horizontal.
VALUES.TITLE: bt

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Left-to-right block flow. Layout is vertical.
VALUES.TITLE: lr

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Right-to-left block flow. Layout is vertical.
VALUES.TITLE: rl

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. Top-to-bottom block flow. Layout is horizontal.
VALUES.TITLE: tb

css\/properties\/max-height.SUMMARY: Sets the maximum height for an element. It prevents the height of the element to exceed the specified value. If min-height is specified and is greater than max-height, max-height is overridden.
css\/properties\/max-height.COMPUTEDVALUE: The percentage as specified or the absolute length or 'none'

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. Clears the max-height value. The height property can have any value.
VALUES.TITLE: none

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: See css calc function for mode details.
VALUES.TITLE: calc()

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Fill the entire available space of from the containing block (Height minus horizontal margin, border and padding of the containing block). Requires CSS Intrinsic & Extrinsic Sizing Module support in browsers.
VALUES.TITLE: fill-available

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: If the total available space is finite, equals to min(max-content, max(min-content, fill-available)). Otherwise, equal to the max-content measure. Requires CSS Intrinsic & Extrinsic Sizing Module support in browsers.
VALUES.TITLE: fit-content

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Specifies a fixed height. Negative values are not allowed. See length for possible units.
VALUES.TITLE: length

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The narrowest space a box could take while fitting around its contents if none of the soft wrap opportunities within the box were taken.(Space/Punctuation in text are examples of a soft-wrap opportunity). Requires CSS Intrinsic & Extrinsic Sizing Module support in browsers.
VALUES.TITLE: max-content

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The narrowest measure a box could take that doesn't lead to inline-dimension overflow that could be avoided by choosing a larger measure. Roughly, the measure that would fit around its contents if all soft wrap opportunities within the box were taken. Requires CSS Intrinsic & Extrinsic Sizing Module support in browsers.
VALUES.TITLE: min-content

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A <percentage> relative to the height of the containing block. If the containing block has no height explicitly set then is is treated as none. Negative values are not allowed.
VALUES.TITLE: percentage

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Takes the same specified value as the property for the element's parent.
VALUES.TITLE: inherit

css\/properties\/unicode-bidi.SUMMARY: The unicode-bidi CSS property specifies the level of embedding with respect to the bidirectional algorithm.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Same as the embed value, except that, inside the element, reordering is strictly in sequence according to the direction property. This value overrides the implicit bidirectional algorithm.
VALUES.TITLE: bidi-override

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Element opens an additional level of embedding. The value of the direction property specifies the embedding level. Reordering is implicit inside the element.
VALUES.TITLE: embed

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. Element does not open an additional level of embedding. For inline elements, implicit reordering works across element boundaries.
VALUES.TITLE: normal

css\/properties\/column-span.SUMMARY: The column-span CSS property makes it possible for an element to span across all columns when its value is set to all. An element that spans more than one column is called a spanning element.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. The content block does not span multiple columns.
VALUES.TITLE: none

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The content block spans all columns on a page. All content that is declared before the content block is shown before the content block.
VALUES.TITLE: all

css\/properties\/border-image-source.SUMMARY: The property border-image-source is used to set the image to be used instead of the border style. If this is set to none the border-style is used instead.
css\/properties\/border-image-source.COMPUTEDVALUE: ‘none’ or the image with its URI made absolute

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. border-style is used instead.
VALUES.TITLE: none

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: This value contains a path to an image that you want to apply to the element in question as a background image, using the CSS images syntax, as described at "CSS images: url()".
VALUES.TITLE: url(path/to/image.png)

css\/properties\/user-focus.SUMMARY: This is for all the high level UX stuff.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: None of the descendants of the element can be brought under consideration or focus, neither text nor images.
VALUES.TITLE: none

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. Every single thing is under focus.
VALUES.TITLE: all

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Only text of the element and its descendants can be focused or brought under consideration..
VALUES.TITLE: text

css\/properties\/appearance.SUMMARY: Allows changing the style of any element to platform-based interface elements or vice versa.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: No special styling is applied. For Firefox note bug 649849 and bug 605985
VALUES.TITLE: none

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Firefox specific - but no effect in latest version
VALUES.TITLE: button-arrow-down

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Firefox specific - but no effect in latest version
VALUES.TITLE: button-arrow-next

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Firefox specific - but no effect in latest version
VALUES.TITLE: button-arrow-previous

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Firefox specific - but no effect in latest version
VALUES.TITLE: button-arrow-up

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Use button bevel theme for rendering the object. Seems to work only in mozilla based browsers
VALUES.TITLE: button-bevel

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Firefox specific - but no effect in latest version
VALUES.TITLE: button-focus

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The element is drawn like a button
VALUES.TITLE: button

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: No clear visual effect.
VALUES.TITLE: caret

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Firefox specific - but no effect in latest version
VALUES.TITLE: checkbox-container

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Firefox specific - but no effect in latest version
VALUES.TITLE: checkbox-small

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The element is drawn like a checkbox, including only the actual "checkbox" portion.
VALUES.TITLE: checkbox

css\/properties\/border-left-width.SUMMARY: Sets the width of an element's left border. To set all four borders, use the border-width shorthand property which sets the values simultaneously for border-top-width, border-right-width, border-bottom-width, and border-left-width.
css\/properties\/border-left-width.COMPUTEDVALUE: An absolute length; 0 if the border style is 'none' or 'hidden'

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Floating-point number, followed by an absolute units designator (cm, mm, in, pt, or pc) or a relative units designator (em, ex, or px). For more information about the supported length units, see CSS Values and Units Reference.
VALUES.TITLE: <width>

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default.
VALUES.TITLE: medium

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Greater than the default width.
VALUES.TITLE: thick

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Less than the default width.
VALUES.TITLE: thin

css\/properties\/hyphenate-limit-zone.SUMMARY: Specifies the maximum amount of trailing whitespace (before justification) that may be left in a line before hyphenation is triggered to pull part of a word from the next line back up into the current one.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Indicates the width of the hyphenation zone. Lengths set in font-relative units (em, ex, ch) tend to be more useful here. Negative values are not allowed.
VALUES.TITLE: length

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the width of the hyphenation zone, relative to the total line length. Negative values are not allowed.
VALUES.TITLE: percentage

css\/properties\/mask-box-image-source.SUMMARY: Specifies an image to be used as mask. If the value is "none", the image cannot be displayed, or the property doesn't apply, the content will not be masked.

css\/properties\/border-top.SUMMARY: Shorthand property that defines the border-width, border-style and border-color of an element's top border in a single declaration. Note that you can use the corresponding longhand properties to set specific individual properties of the top border — border-top-width, border-top-style and border-top-color.
css\/properties\/border-top.INITIALVALUE: For style values, the initial value is none. For color values, the initial value is currentColor.  For width values, the initial value is medium, which is computed as about 3px in most browsers..

VALUES.DESCRIPTION:
The border-top property can contain up to three components:

  • border-width: This takes a numeric value with any of the standard length units.
  • border-style: This takes any of the range of style values available to the border-style property, which includes none, hidden, dotted, dashed, solid, double, groove, ridge, inset, outset. For more details about each, see the border-style page.
  • color: This can take any valid CSS color as its value.
VALUES.TITLE: border-width border-style color

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: When we set the value to inherit, the element will inherit the border values set on its parent.
VALUES.TITLE: inherit

css\/properties\/border-radius.SUMMARY: The border-radius CSS property allows authors to round the corners of an element. The rounding can be different per-corner, and it could have different horizontal and vertical radii, to produce elliptical curves.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Specifying two sets of length values separated by a forward slash equates to specifying separate lengths for the X and Y radii of the corners, resulting in elliptical corners if the X and Y radii have different lengths. Each set can consist of one, two, three or four values.
VALUES.TITLE: length / length

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Denotes the size of the circle radius or the horizontal and vertical radii, for elliptical curves. It can be expressed in any unit allowed in CSS <length> data types. em units are useful for controls that scale proportionally with the font-size. Viewport-relative units (vw, vh, vmin, vmax) can be useful for controls that scale with the viewport size. Negative values are invalid. You can specify a single length for all four corners, or two, three or four lengths to specify different lengths for different corners: see the syntax section for more details.
VALUES.TITLE: length

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Specifying two sets of percentage values separated by a forward slash equates to specifying separate percentages for the X and Y radii of the corners, resulting in elliptical corners if the X and Y radii have percentages resulting in different computed values (depending on the width and height of the element, different percentages might result in the same computed values; see the remarks section for more). Each set can consist of one, two, three or four values.
VALUES.TITLE: percentage / percentage

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Denotes the size of the corner radius, in percentages of the box’s border-box dimensions. Specifically, percentages for the horizontal axis refer to the width of the border-box, percentages for the vertical axis refer to the height of the border-box. Negative values are invalid. You can specify a single percentage for all four corners, or two, three or four percentages to specify different percentages for different corners: see the syntax section for more details.
VALUES.TITLE: percentage

css\/properties\/orphans.SUMMARY:
In typography terms, an orphan is the first line of a paragraph that is left behind on the old page while the paragraph continues on the next. The orphans CSS property refers to the minimum number of lines in a block container that must be left at the bottom of the old page. This property is normally used to control how page breaks occur. This property only affects paged media such as print. For example, if a paragraph can't fit on one page in its entirety it is split wherever it is possible. In this way single lines of a paragraph can appear on page before it continues on the next page. This is usually unwanted, so many word processors require at least two lines to be left on an old page, instead of one. You can give it either a positive number (where 2 is the default) or inherit.

Note that the orphan property does not generally affect non-paged media such as screen. However, browsers supporting both orphans and columns will apply the intended functionality to columns as well. Also, the property only affects block-level elements.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Only positive values are allowed. A String that specifies or receives the minimum number of lines to print at the bottom of a page.
VALUES.TITLE: integer

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Takes the same specified value as the property for the element's parent.
VALUES.TITLE: inherit

css\/properties\/shape-image-threshold.SUMMARY: Defines the alpha channel threshold used to extract a shape from an image.
css\/properties\/shape-image-threshold.COMPUTEDVALUE: As specified, clamped to a 0.0-1.0 range

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: A <number> value used to set the threshold used for extracting a shape from an image. Any values outside the range 0.0 (fully transparent) to 1.0 (fully opaque) will be clamped to this range.
VALUES.TITLE: <alphavalue>

css\/properties\/wrap-through.SUMMARY: Specifies whether an element respects its parent's wrapping context (which is defined by the use of the wrap-flow property).

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: This element's inline content ignores its parent's wrapping context. Content will only wrap around exclusions defined inside this element
VALUES.TITLE: none

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: This element's inline content respects its parent's wrapping context. Content will wrap around exclusions defined outside this element and inside this element
VALUES.TITLE: wrap

css\/properties\/clip.SUMMARY: Lets you specify the dimensions of an absolutely positioned element that should be visible, and the element is clipped into this shape, and displayed.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Default. Clip to expose entire object.
VALUES.TITLE: auto

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Top, right, bottom, and left specify length values, any of which can be replaced by auto, leaving that side not clipped. The value of top specifies that everything above this value on the Y axis (with 0 at the top) is clipped. The value of right specifies that everything above this value on the X axis (with 0 at the left) is clipped. The value of bottom specifies that everything below this value on the Y axis (with 0 at the top) is clipped. The value of left specifies that everything to the left of this value on the X axis (with 0 at the left) is clipped.
VALUES.TITLE: rect(top, right, bottom, left)

css\/properties\/font-weight.SUMMARY: The font-weight property specifies the weight or boldness of the font (their degree of blackness or stroke thickness). Note that some fonts are not available in all weights; some are available only on normal and bold.
css\/properties\/font-weight.COMPUTEDVALUE: The keyword or the numerical value as specified, with bolder and lighter transformed to the real value.

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Numeric font weights for fonts that provide more than just normal and bold. If the exact weight given is unavailable, a face with a nearby weight is used.
Bold font weight. Same as 700.
VALUES.TITLE: bold

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: One font weight darker than the parent element (among the available weights of the font).
VALUES.TITLE: bolder

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: One font weight lighter than the parent element (among the available weights of the font).
VALUES.TITLE: lighter

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: Normal font weight. Same as 400.
VALUES.TITLE: normal

css\/properties\/flex-basis.SUMMARY: The flex-basis CSS property describes the initial main size of the flex item before any free space is distributed according to the flex factors described in the flex property (flex-grow and flex-shrink).

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: The flex item's initial main size is determined by either the width or height property, whichever is in the main dimension, as determined by the flex-direction property. Note that the value of the width or height property itself may be auto, in which case the size is determined by the flex item's contents.
VALUES.TITLE: auto

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: In a vertical writing mode; percentage values of flex-basis are resolved against the flex item's flex container, and if that containing block's size is indefinite, the result is undefined.
VALUES.TITLE: height

VALUES.DESCRIPTION: In a horizontal writing mode; percentage values of flex-basis are resolved against the flex item's flex container, and if that containing block's size is indefinite, the result is undefined.
VALUES.TITLE: width

css\/properties\/animation-iteration-cou.SUMMARY: Specifies how many times an animation cycle should play

VALUES.DESCRIPTION:
<number> or infinite.

<number>
